item.title: Hong Kong-listed Chinese miner CMOC takes Glencore’s cobalt crown as output jumps 170% in 2023
item.description:
English Summary：

  • CMOC Group, a Chinese mining company, produced 55,526 tonnes of cobalt in 2023, surpassing Glencore as the world's top producer of the metal.
  • The increased output from CMOC's Kisanfu mine in the Democratic Republic of Congo was a major factor in the 30% decline in cobalt prices last year.
  • China's demand for EVs drove the surge in cobalt production, with over 60% of global sales coming from the country in 2023.
  • Cobalt is a key material in lithium-ion batteries, which are used in electric vehicles and offer longer driving ranges than other battery technologies.
  • Despite the increase in cobalt production, electric vehicle sales in China are expected to grow at a slower pace in 2024, from 30% to 20% year-over-year.

中文总结：

  • 中国矿业公司CMOC集团在2023年生产了55,526吨钴，使其超越嘉能可在全球钴产量中排名第一。
  • CMOC在刚果民主共和国的Kisanfu矿山的产量增加是去年钴价下跌30％的主要因素。
  • 中国对电动汽车的需求推动了钴产量的激增，2023年中国占全球销量的60％以上。
  • 钴是锂离子电池中的关键材料，后者用于电动汽车并提供比其他电池技术更长的续航里程。
  • 尽管钴产量增加，但预计2024年中国电动汽车的销量将以较慢的速度增长，从2023年的30%增长到2024年的20%。

单词：

  • Excavators (n.) - /ˈɛks.kə.veɪ.tər/ 挖掘机, 铲土机.

    原文例句：Excavators and drillers work in an open pit at Tenke Fungurume, a copper and cobalt mine in the Democratic Republic of Congo.

    例句讲解：这个单词源自拉丁语Excavate，意思是“挖出”。在这个例句中，它指的是在刚果民主共和国的Tenke Fungurume铜钴矿的一个露天矿坑中工作的挖掘机和钻机。

  • forecast (v.) - /fɔːrˈkæst/ 预测，预报。

    原文例句：In October, Glencore forecast output of as much as 42,000 tonnes.

    例句讲解：这个单词由fore（前面）和cast（投掷）组成，意思是“投掷到前面，预报”。在这个例句中，它指的是嘉能可在十月份预测的产量可能达到42000吨。

  • surplus (n.) - /ˈsɜːr.pləs/ 过剩，盈余。

    原文例句：The market was already in one of its biggest ever surpluses as 2023 began, and the additional output helped drive a 30 per cent slump in prices over the year.

    例句讲解：这个单词源自拉丁语surplus，意思是“过多的，剩余的”。在这个例句中，它指的是在2023年开始时，市场已经处于有史以来最大的盈余之一，而额外的产量导致价格在今年下降了30％。

词组：

  • by midyear - 到年中。

    原文例句：By midyear Glencore had started to stockpile surplus at its operations in Congo in a bid to bring the market back into balance.

    例句讲解：这个词组是由by（在……之前），midyear（年中）构成，表示“到年中”。在这个例句中，它表示嘉能可在年中开始在其刚果的运营中储存盈余，以使市场恢复平衡。

  • in addition - 此外，另外。

    原文例句：Soaring output at the US$1.8 billion Kisanfu mine helped trigger a sharp slump in cobalt prices last year, alongside rising production in Indonesia and a rebound in exports from CMOC’s other operation in Congo, Tenke-Fungurume.

    例句讲解：这个词组是由in（在……中），addition（添加，增加）构成，表示“在……中添加，此外”。在这个例句中，它表示美国18亿美元的Kisanfu矿山的产量激增，导致去年钴价大幅下跌，此外还有印度尼西亚的产量增加和CMOC在刚果的另一家运营商Tenke-Fungurume的出口反弹，这两个因素也造成了钴价下跌。

句子：

  • Cobalt is a material used in NCM (lithium, nickel, cobalt and manganese) batteries powering electric cars, which offer vehicles a longer driving range than nickel-based LFP (lithium, iron and phosphate) counterparts.

    • 句子分析：这是一个长句，由主句Cobalt is a material used in NCM batteries和两个定语从句that power electric cars和which offer vehicles a longer driving range than nickel-based LFP counterparts组成。主句中的谓语是is，主语是Cobalt，宾语是a material used in NCM batteries。定了语从句that power electric cars是对Cobalt is a material used in NCM batteries的补充说明，说明钴是用于电动汽车的NCM电池的材料。定语从句which offer vehicles a longer driving range than nickel-based LFP counterparts是对Cobalt is a material used in NCM batteries的进一步补充说明，说明钴是用于电动汽车的NCM电池的材料，并且这种电池可以使汽车具有比基于镍的LFP电池更长的续航里程。这个句子的意思是说，钴是用于NCM（锂、镍、钴和锰）电池的材料，这种电池为电动汽车提供动力，并且比基于镍的LFP（锂、铁和磷酸盐）电池能使汽车具有更长的续航里程。

语法：

  • since从句 - 表示从过去某个时间一直持续到现在的动作或状态。

    原文例句：CMOC’s copper output also jumped by 51 per cent to 419,539 tonnes, establishing it as one of the world’s top producers at a time when many miners are struggling to boost output.

    语法讲解：这是一个since从句，表示从过去某个时间一直持续到现在的动作或状态。结构是：since + 时间点/时间段 + 主语 + 谓语。其中since表示“从……以来”，时间点/时间段表示从句开始的时间，主语是动作或状态的执行者，谓语是动作或状态的描述。在这个例句中，since表示从过去某个时间以来，时间点/时间段没有给出，主语是CMOC’s copper output，谓语是jumped by 51 per cent to 419,539 tonnes。这个句子的意思是说，CMOC的铜产量也增长了51%，达到419,539吨，使其成为世界上最大的铜生产商之一，而这段时间里许多矿工都在努力提高产量。

  • 定语从句 - 表示对某个先行词进行修饰或说明。

    原文例句：Electric vehicles (EVs) would account for 34 per cent of global sales by 2028 and make up 61 per cent of sales in 2035, compared to 14 per cent in 2022.

    语法讲解：这是一个定语从句，对先行词Electric vehicles (EVs)进行修饰或说明。结构是：[先行词] + 关系代词 + 主语 + 谓语。其中关系代词是指代先行词的词，主语是动作或状态的执行者，谓语是动作或状态的描述。在这个例句中，先行词是Electric vehicles (EVs)，关系代词是would，主语是account for 34 per cent of global sales by 2028，谓语是make up

    • The company’s output of the key metal in EV batteries exceeded its own guidance by more than 20 per cent
    • Soaring output at CMOC’s US$1.8 billion Kisanfu mine helped trigger a sharp slump in cobalt prices last year

    China’s CMOC Group boosted its cobalt output by more than 170 per cent last year, with surging production at a new mine in the Democratic Republic of Congo helping the company leapfrog Glencore as the world’s top producer of the key battery metal.

    Hong Kong-listed CMOC produced 55,526 tonnes of cobalt in 2023, it said in a filing on Thursday. In October, Glencore forecast output of as much as 42,000 tonnes. While investors and traders had been expecting a large increase at CMOC’s massive Kisanfu mine – which came online in the second quarter – the full-year result exceeded the company’s own production guidance by more than 20 per cent.

    Soaring output at the US$1.8 billion Kisanfu mine helped trigger a sharp slump in cobalt prices last year, alongside rising production in Indonesia and a rebound in exports from CMOC’s other operation in Congo, Tenke-Fungurume. The market was already in one of its biggest ever surpluses as 2023 began, and the additional output helped drive a 30 per cent slump in prices over the year.

    The mismatch between supply and demand became so acute that by midyear Glencore had started to stockpile surplus at its operations in Congo in a bid to bring the market back into balance. Glencore is set to announce its full production results next month.

    CMOC’s copper output also jumped by 51 per cent to 419,539 tonnes, establishing it as one of the world’s top producers at a time when many miners are struggling to boost output.

    Cobalt is a material used in NCM (lithium, nickel, cobalt and manganese) batteries powering electric cars, which offer vehicles a longer driving range than nickel-based LFP (lithium, iron and phosphate) counterparts.

    Global consultancy AlixPartners forecast in a research report in July that electric vehicles (EVs) would account for 34 per cent of global sales by 2028 and make up 61 per cent of sales in 2035, compared to 14 per cent in 2022.

    In China, the EV penetration rate exceeded 40 per cent in 2023 amid motorists’ rising penchant for environmentally friendly cars featuring autonomous driving technology and digital cockpits.

    Mainland China is now the world’s largest automotive and EV market, with sales of battery-powered cars accounting for about 60 per cent of the global total.

    Chinese EV battery maker Gotion starts making energy storage packs in US

    Electric vehicle (EV) sales on the mainland, however, are seen growing 20 per cent year on year in 2024, according to a Fitch Ratings’ report in November, slowing from the projected 30 per cent increase in 2023.

    Seoul-based consultancy SNE Research said in a report last February that electric cars with a driving range of more than 300 kilometres were sold at about US$30,000, on par with prices of petrol-powered vehicles, which helped EVs gain popularity around the globe.

    Additional reporting by Daniel Ren

item.title: Qualcomm unveils chip for mixed reality to compete with Apple’s Vision Pro
item.description:
English summary：

Qualcomm has introduced the Snapdragon XR2+ chip, designed for virtual and mixed reality headsets. It can power 12 or more high-definition cameras and will be used by Samsung and Google. XR chip has been a vital component in several companies' attempts to attract consumers to the market, which has yet to gain traction. Augmented reality and virtual reality differ in their presentation techniques. Apple and Meta headsets integrate both technologies. Qualcomm's XR chip has been utilized in Microsoft and Meta devices.
  • Abstract: Qualcomm unveils the Snapdragon XR2+ chip for virtual and mixed reality headsets, targeting advanced visual experiences.
  • Theme: The evolution of XR technology and the competitive landscape in the virtual and mixed reality market.
  • Viewpoint: Qualcomm's contribution to the development and advancement of XR technology.
  • Main information: Features and capabilities of the Snapdragon XR2+ chip; adoption by Samsung and Google; potential applications in virtual and mixed reality headsets; industry competition and challenges.

中文总结：

高通公司最新推出骁龙XR2+芯片，专用于虚拟现实和混合现实头显。该芯片可驱动12个或更多高清摄像头，并将被三星和谷歌在研产品采用。XR芯片一直是多家公司吸引消费者购买该品类的核心组成部分，但该市场尚未起飞。增强现实和虚拟现实两种技术在呈现方式上有所不同。苹果和Meta头显均结合了这两种技术。高通的XR芯片已被微软和Meta设备采用。
  • 摘要：高通推出骁龙XR2+芯片，用于虚拟现实和混合现实头显，带来更出色的视觉体验。
  • 主题：XR技术的演进以及虚拟现实和混合现实市场的竞争格局。
  • 观点：高通在XR技术发展和进步中的贡献。
  • 主要信息：骁龙XR2+芯片的特点和功能；三星和谷歌的采用；虚拟现实和混合现实头显中的潜在应用；行业竞争和挑战。

单词：

  • Immerse (v.) - /ɪˈmɜːrs/ 沉浸，专心于。

    原文例句：Staff at the Hong Kong Science Museum immerse themselves in a virtual reality experience, November 9. 2023.

    例句讲解：这个单词来源于Latin，由in（进入）和mergere（使沉没）组成，意为“使沉没，使沉浸”。在这个例句中，它描述了香港科技馆的工作人员沉浸在虚拟现实体验中。

  • Perception (n.) - /pəˈsɛpʃən/ 知觉，感知。

    原文例句：The chip’s ability to handle more cameras will aid in-depth perception and the eye tracking required to orient the user in the real world and recognise items.

    例句讲解：这个单词来源于Latin，由per（通过）和capere（取）组成，意为“通过某种方式获取，感知”。在这个例句中，它描述了芯片处理更多摄像头的能力将有助于深度感知和眼动追踪，以便在现实世界中定位用户并识别物品。

词组：

  • take off - 开始，获得进展。

    原文例句：The market for devices that project information onto the user’s view of the physical world was fired up last year by Apple’s announcement that it would sell a mixed-reality headset.

    例句讲解：这个词组由take（拿，取）和off（离开）组成，表示“开始，起飞，获得进展”。在这个例句中，它表示去年苹果公司宣布将出售混合现实头盔后，投射信息到用户视野中的设备市场开始启动。

句子：

  • Qualcomm, the biggest maker of mobile phone processors, announced the Snapdragon XR2+ chip designed for virtual and mixed reality headsets that will compete with Apple’s forthcoming Vision Pro. - 高通作为最大的手机处理器制造商，宣布推出骁龙XR2+芯片，该芯片专为虚拟现实和混合现实头显设计，将与苹果即将推出的Vision Pro展开竞争。

    句子分析：这是一个复合句，主句是Qualcomm announced the Snapdragon XR2+ chip，其中主语是Qualcomm，谓语是announced，宾语是the Snapdragon XR2+ chip。designed for virtual and mixed reality headsets that will compete with Apple’s forthcoming Vision Pro是一个过去分词短语作定语，修饰chip，表示该芯片专为虚拟现实和混合现实头显设计，将与苹果即将推出的Vision Pro展开竞争。这个句子的意思是说，高通作为最大的手机处理器制造商，宣布推出骁龙XR2+芯片，该芯片专为虚拟现实和混合现实头显设计，将与苹果即将推出的Vision Pro展开竞争。

语法：

  • 并列连词 - 用于连接两个或两个以上词语、短语或句子，表示并列关系。

    原文例句：That improvement in quality will ease eye fatigue from reading text, reduce the potential for motion sickness and let device makers implement new features.

    语法讲解：并列连词是连接词的一种，用于连接两个或两个以上词语、短语或句子，表示并列关系。常见的并列连词有and、but、or、so、yet等。在这个例句中，并列连词and被用来连接三个分句，表示这三个分句并列关系。

  • 虚拟语气 - 用于表示说话者对某件事的假设、愿望、请求或建议。

    原文例句：Qualcomm is working with a number of partners in addition to Google and Samsung, and announcements from customers may come as soon as next week’s CES show with products available as early as this year, he said.

    语法讲解：虚拟语气是英语中一种特殊的语气，用于表示说话者对某件事的假设、愿望、请求或建议。虚拟语气的标志是使用would、should、could、might、may等情态动词或be动词的过去式。在这个例句中，虚拟语气被用来表示高通公司与谷歌和三星以外にも许多合作伙伴合作，并且客户的公告可能最早在下周的CES展会上发布，产品最早可能在今年推出。

  • The chip maker said the new component, which can run 12 or more high-definition cameras, will be used by Samsung and Google
  • Qualcomm’s chips have been at the heart of many other companies’ attempts to lure consumers to the category, which has not yet taken off

Qualcomm, the biggest maker of mobile phone processors, announced the Snapdragon XR2+ chip designed for virtual and mixed reality headsets that will compete with Apple’s forthcoming Vision Pro.

The San Diego-based chip maker said the new component, which can run 12 or more high-definition cameras, will be used by Samsung Electronics and Alphabet’s Google on products under development.

The market for devices that project information onto the user’s view of the physical world was fired up last year by Apple’s announcement that it would sell a mixed-reality headset. Qualcomm’s chips have been at the heart of many other companies’ attempts to lure consumers to the category, which has not yet taken off.

Virtual reality could be key to easing fears in surgical patients: study

Augmented reality imposes graphics and written content on top of a person’s view of the world. Virtual reality places a consumer in a closed digital world. Apple’s coming Vision Pro and Meta Platform’s most-recent Quest 3 headset mix the technologies. Previous versions Qualcomm’s XR chip have featured in devices from Microsoft and Meta.

Headsets with the XR2+ will use processors and graphics components that are as much as 20 per cent better than their predecessors to project 4K-resolution images on each lens, according to Qualcomm’s Said Bakadir, a senior director of product management.

That improvement in quality will ease eye fatigue from reading text, reduce the potential for motion sickness and let device makers implement new features, he said. The chip’s ability to handle more cameras will aid in-depth perception and the eye tracking required to orient the user in the real world and recognise items.

“A lot of people want more juice to do more things,” Bakadir said. “People want to push the platform even higher.”

Qualcomm is working with a number of partners in addition to Google and Samsung, and announcements from customers may come as soon as next week’s CES show with products available as early as this year, he said.

item.title: OpenAI in talks with dozens of publishers to license content
item.description:
Summary：

OpenAI and news publisher Politico's parent company Axel Springer recently signed a multi-year licensing agreement worth tens of millions of dollars. OpenAI is actively negotiating licensing deals with numerous publishers to obtain content for training its artificial intelligence (AI) models. This is crucial as OpenAI strives to balance the need for updated, accurate data with concerns about data sourcing in its model-building process. However, The New York Times filed a lawsuit against OpenAI and Microsoft for using its articles without permission. This lawsuit poses significant challenges to OpenAI, including potential financial implications and the need to modify its training data, affecting its deal-making efforts with the media industry.
  • Abstract: OpenAI's licensing deal with Politico and its ongoing negotiations with publishers for training AI models.
  • Theme: The importance of licensing agreements for OpenAI's AI training and the legal challenges posed by The New York Times' lawsuit.
  • Viewpoint: Balancing the need for updated data for AI training with concerns about data sourcing; the potential impact of the lawsuit on OpenAI's business and deal-making.
  • Main information: OpenAI's licensing deal with Axel Springer; negotiations with various publishers; The New York Times' lawsuit and its implications for OpenAI's training data and financial stability.

总结：

OpenAI最近与Politico的母公司Axel Springer签署了一份多年的授权协议，价值数千万美元。OpenAI正在积极与众多出版商谈判授权协议，以获得内容来训练其人工智能（AI）模型。这至关重要，因为OpenAI在努力平衡模型构建过程对更新、准确数据的需求与有关数据来源的担忧。然而，《纽约时报》因未经允许使用其文章而对OpenAI和微软提起诉讼。此案给OpenAI带来了重大挑战，包括潜在的财务影响和修改其训练数据的需要，影响了其与媒体行业的交易。
  • 摘要：OpenAI与Politico的授权协议以及与出版商正在进行的谈判，以训练AI模型。
  • 主题：授权协议对OpenAI的AI训练的重要性，以及《纽约时报》的诉讼所带来的法律挑战。
  • 观点：平衡AI训练对更新数据的需求与对数据来源的担忧；诉讼对OpenAI业务和交易的潜在影响。
  • 主要信息：OpenAI与Axel Springer的授权协议；与多家出版商的谈判；《纽约时报》的诉讼及其对OpenAI的训练数据和财务稳定性的影响。

Words：

  • strive (v.) - /straɪv/ 努力以达到某一目的。

    原文例句:“Here, the content is used for training a model. It’s not used to reproduce the content. It’s not used to replace the content.”

    例句讲解：“在这里，内容用于训练模型。它不做重复内容之用，它不做替代内容之用。”这个例句中的“strive”作谓语动词，意思是努力以达到某一目的，在这个例子中，OpenAI正在努力使他们的AI模型更加准确和智能。

  • implication (n.) - /ɪmplɪˈkeɪʃ(ə)n/ 含义，暗示。

    原文例句：“The current situation is vastly different than the situations that the publishers faced in the past with search engines and social media,” Rubin said.

    例句讲解：“Rubin说：“目前的情况与过去出版商在搜索引擎和社交媒体中面临的情况非常不同。”这个例句中的“implication”作宾语，意思是含义，暗示，这个例子中的“implication”指的是OpenAI和出版商之间的情况与搜索引擎和社交媒体之间的情况的区别。

Phrases：

  • artificial intelligence (AI) - 人工智能。

    原文例句：“The Times, however, disagrees with OpenAI’s stance, arguing that ChatGPT is flat out copying its journalists’ work without paying for it.”

    例句讲解：“然而，《纽约时报》不同意OpenAI的立场，认为ChatGPT完全是在不支付费用的情况下复制其记者的作品。”这个例句中的“artificial intelligence (AI)”作主语，意思是人工智能，这个例子中的“artificial intelligence (AI)”指的是OpenAI开发的语言模型ChatGPT。

  • balance the need for ... with ... - 平衡对……的需要和……之间。

    原文例句：“OpenAI said it is talking to dozens of publishers about striking deals to license their articles, a broader effort than was previously known as the start-up looks for content to train its artificial intelligence models.”

    例句讲解：“OpenAI表示，它正在与数十家出版商谈判授权协议，这是一个比以前已知范围更广泛的努力，这家初创公司正在寻找内容来训练其人工智能模型。”这个例句中的“balance the need for ... with ...”作状语，意思是平衡对……的需要和……之间，在这个例子中，“balance the need for ... with ...”指的是OpenAI在寻找内容来训练人工智能模型时，需要平衡对最新、准确数据的需求和对数据来源的担忧之间。

Sentences：

  • OpenAI is in the middle of many negotiations and discussions with many publishers. - OpenAI正在与许多出版商进行许多谈判和讨论。

    句子分析：这个句子是一个主动语态的一般现在时句，主语是OpenAI，谓语是is in the middle of many negotiations and discussions with many publishers，作宾语的是many negotiations and discussions with many publishers。这个句子的意思是OpenAI正在与许多出版商进行许多谈判和讨论。

Grammar：

  • 被动语态 - 表示动作或状态是由句子中的宾语承受的。

    原文例句：“The suit poses an existential challenge to OpenAI’s business.”

    语法讲解：这是一个被动语态的句子，主语是The suit，谓语是poses，宾语是an existential challenge to OpenAI’s business。这个句子的意思是这场诉讼对OpenAI的业务构成了一个存在的挑战。

  • 非谓语动词 - 不能单独作谓语，只能作定语、状语或表语。

    原文例句：“It’s not used to reproduce the content. It’s not used to replace the content.”

    语法讲解：在这个句子中，to reproduce the content和to replace the content都是非谓语动词，它们分别作定语和状语。to reproduce the content作定语，修饰content，意思是复制内容；to replace the content作状语，修饰not used，意思是取代内容。这个句子的意思是它不用于复制内容，它不用于取代内容。

  • OpenAI recently inked a multi-year licensing deal with Politico’s parent company Axel Springer for tens of millions of dollars
  • One of the companies it had been in talks with, The New York Times, sued OpenAI and Microsoft for using articles without permission

OpenAI said it is talking to dozens of publishers about striking deals to license their articles, a broader effort than was previously known as the start-up looks for content to train its artificial intelligence models.

“We are in the middle of many negotiations and discussions with many publishers. They are active. They are very positive. They’re progressing well,” Tom Rubin, OpenAI’s chief of intellectual property and content, told Bloomberg News. “You’ve seen deals announced, and there will be more in the future.”

OpenAI recently inked a multi-year licensing deal with Politico’s parent company Axel Springer for tens of millions of dollars, a person familiar with the matter previously told Bloomberg. In July, OpenAI announced an agreement with the Associated Press for an undisclosed amount. These deals are key to OpenAI’s future as it is balancing the need for updated, accurate data to build its models with growing scrutiny about where that data is sourced from.

Chinese AI champion SenseTime introduces Go playing robot to Japan, South Korea

But last week, one of the companies it had been in talks with, The New York Times Co, sued OpenAI and Microsoft for using the publication’s articles without permission.

The suit poses an existential challenge to OpenAI’s business. If the Times wins the case, OpenAI may not only owe billions of dollars, but could also be forced to destroy any of its training data that includes work from the Times, a costly and complicated task. More immediately, however, the lawsuit complicates OpenAI’s deal-making efforts with the media industry.

“The current situation is vastly different than the situations that the publishers faced in the past with search engines and social media,” Rubin said. “Here, the content is used for training a model. It’s not used to reproduce the content. It’s not used to replace the content.”

China’s cloud market growth plateaus despite big AI push

The Times, however, disagrees with OpenAI’s stance, arguing that ChatGPT is flat out copying its journalists’ work without paying for it. In its lawsuit, the publisher showed examples in which ChatGPT spit out entire paragraphs of nearly verbatim text from The New York Times (although some have pointed out that in certain examples, it was specifically prompting ChatGPT to reproduce Times content). The publisher argues that is proof OpenAI used New York Times data.

“If Microsoft and OpenAI want to use our work for commercial purposes, the law requires that they first obtain our permission,” The New York Times said in a statement. “They have not done so.”

item.title: Hong Kong-based AI-driven company sells potential breast cancer drug in deal whose value could exceed US$500 million
item.description:
English Summary：

  • Insilico Medicine, an AI-driven drug discovery company based in Hong Kong, has entered into a deal with Menarini Group, an Italy-based pharmaceutical company, to develop and commercialize a novel AI-powered small molecule inhibitor for hormone-sensitive cancers, including breast cancer.
  • The agreement grants Stemline Therapeutics, a subsidiary of Menarini, the exclusive global rights to develop and market the drug, with a total potential value exceeding US$500 million.
  • This collaboration highlights the growing role of AI technology in revolutionizing drug discovery, offering greater efficiency, accuracy, and cost-saving benefits.

中文总结：

  • Insilico Medicine，一家位于香港的人工智能药物研发公司，与意大利制药公司 Menarini Group 达成协议，共同开发和商业化一种新型的人工智能驱动的治疗激素敏感性癌症（包括乳腺癌）的药物。
  • 根据协议，Menarini 的子公司 Stemline Therapeutics 将获得该药物的全球独家开发和销售权，总潜在价值超过 5 亿美元。
  • 此次合作突显了人工智能技术在药物发现领域日益重要的作用，可带来更高的效率、准确性和成本效益。

单词：

  • hormone-sensitive cancer (n.) - 激素敏感性癌症。

    原文例句：Breast cancer, a hormone-sensitive cancer, is the most common cancer worldwide, and the leading cause of cancer death among women, according to the WHO.

    例句讲解：激素敏感性癌症是指受激素水平影响而生长的癌症。乳腺癌是全球最常见的癌症之一，也是女性癌症死亡的主要原因。

  • AI-driven (adj.) - 人工智能驱动的。

    原文例句：Insilico Medicine, a Hong Kong-based AI-driven drug discovery company...

    例句讲解：人工智能驱动的指的是利用人工智能技术来推进药物发现。Insilico Medicine 是一家位于香港的人工智能药物研发公司，致力于利用人工智能技术来加速新药的开发。

  • small molecule inhibitor (n.) - 小分子抑制剂。

    原文例句：The exclusive licensing agreement grants Stemline the global rights to develop and commercialize a novel small molecule KAT6A inhibitor...

    例句讲解：小分子抑制剂是指能够与特定的蛋白质分子结合并阻止其功能的小分子化合物。 KAT6A 抑制剂是一种新型的小分子抑制剂，有望用于治疗激素敏感性癌症。

词组：

  • compound annual growth rate (CAGR) - 复合年增长率。

    原文例句：The AI-driven drug discovery market is projected to grow at a compound annual growth rate (CAGR) of 23.72 per cent from 2023 to 2030...

    例句讲解：复合年增长率是衡量投资在一定时期内平均每年增长的百分比。 AI 驱动的药物发现市场预计从 2023 年到 2030 年的复合年增长率为 23.72%。

  • clinical trial (n.) - 临床试验。

    原文例句：In June last year, the company revealed an IPO plan in Hong Kong after shelving a New York fundraising plan, to fund clinical trials of drugs discovered and designed by artificial intelligence.

    例句讲解：临床试验是用于评估药物或治疗方法对人体的安全性和有效性的研究。 Insilico Medicine 计划在香港进行首次公开募股 (IPO)，以资助其通过人工智能发现和设计的药物的临床试验。

句子：

  • Insilico, founded by Zhavoronkov in 2014, has a pipeline that consists of 31 programmes for 29 drug targets in cancer, fibrosis, immunity, central nervous system and ageing-related diseases.

    句子分析：这是一个简单句，主语是 Insilico，谓语是 has，宾语是 a pipeline。介词短语 by Zhavoronkov in 2014 表示时间，介词短语 for 29 drug targets 表示目的。从句 consists of 31 programmes 表示 Insilico 的工作重点。

  • Under the exclusive licensing agreement, Insilico has granted Stemline the global rights to develop and commercialize a novel small molecule KAT6A inhibitor as a potential treatment for hormone-sensitive cancers and other oncology indications.

    句子分析：这是一个复合句，主句是 Insilico has granted Stemline the global rights，从句是 Under the exclusive licensing agreement 和 as a potential treatment for hormone-sensitive cancers and other oncology indications。介词短语 Under the exclusive licensing agreement 表示条件，从句 as a potential treatment for hormone-sensitive cancers and other oncology indications 表示目的。

语法：

  • 现在完成时 - 表示从过去某个时间开始一直持续到现在的动作或状态。

    原文例句：In June last year, the company revealed an IPO plan in Hong Kong after shelving a New York fundraising plan, to fund clinical trials of drugs discovered and designed by artificial intelligence.

    语法讲解：现在完成时由 have/has + 过去分词构成。在这个例句中，revealed 是过去分词，表示这个动作发生在过去，但其结果或影响一直持续到现在的。这个句子告诉我们，该公司在去年 6 月公布了一项在香港进行首次公开募股 (IPO) 的计划，以资助其通过人工智能发现和设计的药物的临床试验。

  • 被动语态 - 表示动作或状态是由句子中的宾语承受的。

    原文例句：The agreement comes at a time when cutting-edge technology is playing a greater role in drug discovery.

    语法讲解：被动语态由 be + 过去分词构成。在这个例句中，is playing 是被动语态，表示动作“playing”是由句子中的宾语“technology”承受的。这个句子告诉我们，在当今时代，前沿技术在药物发现中发挥着越来越重要的作用。

  • Insilico grants Italy’s Menarini Group, the global rights to develop and commercialise a novel small molecule inhibitor, as a potential treatment for hormone-sensitive cancers
  • Breast cancer, a hormone-sensitive cancer, is the most common cancer worldwide, and the leading cause of cancer death among women, according to the WHO

Insilico Medicine, a Hong Kong-based AI-driven drug discovery company that intends to list in Hong Kong after it unveiled an initial public offering plan (IPO) last year, has sold its preclinical drug candidate for breast cancer treatment to Italy-based pharmaceutical company Menarini Group in a deal that could reach a value of over US$500 million.

Stemline Therapeutics, a wholly owned unit of Menarini, will make a US$12 million upfront payment to Insilico under the agreement, which will be followed by sales royalties worth up to “double digits”. The combined value of the deal includes all development, regulatory, and commercial milestones.

The agreement comes at a time when cutting-edge technology is playing a greater role in drug discovery. AI has emerged as a catalyst in revolutionising drug discovery by enhancing efficiency and accuracy while reducing the time-consuming aspects of research and development, experts say.

The AI-driven drug discovery market is projected to grow at a compound annual growth rate (CAGR) of 23.72 per cent from 2023 to 2030, reaching an estimated value of US$7.1 billion by 2030, according to US-based Vantage Market Research.

The technology expedites the process of identifying potential drugs, according to Insilico’s founder and co-CEO, Dr Alex Zhavoronkov.

Under the exclusive licensing agreement, Insilico has granted Stemline the global rights to develop and commercialise a novel small molecule KAT6A inhibitor as a potential treatment for hormone-sensitive cancers and other oncology indications.

Sanofi signs with Hong Kong biotech firm Insilico to spur AI drug discovery

Breast cancer is the most common cancer worldwide and the leading cause of cancer death among women, according to the World Health Organization.

The global breast cancer market is projected to hit around US$73.68 billion by 2032 with a registered CAGR of 9.9 per cent, according to Precedence Research.

“The partnership at the early stage preclinical trial is truly optimal when the partner is very committed,” said Zhavoronkov.

Menarini, an international pharmaceutical and diagnostics company with a turnover of more than US$4.4 billion and operations in 140 countries, sees the collaboration with Insilico as an opportunity to explore new treatment approaches and potentially unlock transformative cancer therapies, according to CEO Elcin Barker Ergun.

Insilico, founded by Zhavoronkov in 2014, has a pipeline that consists of 31 programmes for 29 drug targets in cancer, fibrosis, immunity, central nervous system and ageing-related diseases.

In June last year, the company revealed an IPO plan in Hong Kong after shelving a New York fundraising plan, to fund clinical trials of drugs discovered and designed by artificial intelligence.

Zhavoronkov declined to reveal a timeline for its IPO but said market sentiment was a concern.

Insilico has a presence in the markets of the US, Greater China, Canada and the Middle East. It launched the Generative AI and Quantum Computing Research and Development Center in Abu Dhabi in February 2023.

To date, the company has raised more than US$400 million via private markets. In 2022, it secured series D financing of US$95 million from investors such as Prosperity7, a growth venture fund of Saudi Arabia’s Aramco, and others including B Capital Group, Warburg Pincus, and Hong Kong-based Qiming Ventures.

item.title: Chinese EV maker Hozon predicts fivefold jump in overseas sales as growth slows in hyper-competitive domestic market
item.description:
Summary：

The Shanghai-based maker of Neta branded cars aims to deliver 100,000 units in 60 overseas markets in 2024, mainly in Southeast Asia, accounting for one-third of Hozon's total deliveries. The company's first overseas assembly plant in Thailand started operation two months ahead of schedule, with an annual capacity of 20,000 units. The second assembly facility will be operational by the second quarter. Hozon expects to sell 1 million EVs in 2026, including 400,000 outside mainland China, and plans to build plants in the Middle East, Africa, and South America.
  • Abstract: Chinese EV start-up Hozon New Energy Automobile targets significant overseas sales growth in 2024.
  • Theme: Hozon's global expansion strategy to counter slowing domestic growth and fierce competition in the Chinese EV market.
  • Viewpoint: Hozon's confidence in the global appeal of Chinese-made electric cars and its goal of designing and manufacturing EVs for a global audience.
  • Main information: Hozon's sales target of 100,000 units in overseas markets in 2024; the operation of assembly plants in Thailand and Indonesia; plans to build plants in the Middle East, Africa, and South America; Hozon's aim to sell 1 million EVs in 2026, including 400,000 outside mainland China.

总结：

上海总部，生产 Neta 牌汽车的车企希望在今年向 60 个海外市场销售 10万辆汽车，重点放在东南亚市场。公司在泰国的第一家海外工厂于 11 月份开始组装汽车，比预期提前了两个月。2022 年 8 月 24 日，表演者在泰国曼谷的发布仪式上展示了 Hozon NETA V。照片：EPA-EFE中国的电动汽车 (EV) 初创公司 Hozon New Energy Automobile 预计，随着中国汽车制造商对国际销售的信心增强，以便应对国内增长放缓，其在 2024 年的海外销量将增长五倍。据副总裁周江透露，这家总部位于上海、生产 Neta 牌汽车的制造商计划今年在海外市场（主要在东南亚）交付 10 万辆汽车，因为他们已在泰国和印度尼西亚开设了组装厂。他说，到那时，海外销售额将占 Hozon 在 2024 年总交付量的三分之一，预计将达到 30 万辆。“总体而言，中国制造的电动汽车受到世界各地客户的欢迎，”他在周四的媒体简报中说。“此外，我们相信公司的全球视野，即设计和制造面向所有人的电动汽车。”Hozon New Energy Automobile 电动汽车等待从上海运往海外。照片：微博 11 月底时，Hozon（也被称为 Neta Auto）在其第一家泰国海外工厂开始组装汽车，比计划提前了大约两个月。这座工厂的年生产能力为 2 万辆，生产右舵版本的 Neta 汽车。周表示，Hozon 在中国境外的第二家组装厂将在第二季度投入运营。“由于国内市场增长放缓，那些品牌和汽车能够吸引外国买家的中国电动汽车制造商将在未来几年内加大海外扩张力度，”上海咨询公司 Suolei 的高级经理埃里克·汉 (Eric Han) 说。“事实上，他们在家乡的市场上凭借价格竞争，在其他市场享有较高的利润率。”卖空者以比亚迪为目标，全球顶级电动汽车制造商，随着竞争的加剧“哪吒”是 Neta 的名称之一，它在中国神话中是一位保护神。该品牌属于中国经济型电动汽车，目标客户是中低收入人群，他们更喜欢电池驱动的汽车，而不是耗油的内燃机汽车。根据惠誉评级公司在 11 月发布的一份报告，2024 年中国大陆的电动汽车销量预计将同比增长 20%，低于 2023 年预计的 30% 增幅。随着电动汽车市场挤满了 200 家企业，新一轮降价已开始生效，比亚迪（全球最大的制造商）和理想汽车等顶尖企业提供折扣以吸引买家。中国电动汽车：蔚来和小鹏推出目标富裕买家的 MPV 车型Hozon 在 2023 年向国内外客户交付了总计 127,496 辆汽车，较上年同期下降 16%。该公司在 8 月宣布已通过交叉融资交易筹集 70 亿元人民币（9.86 亿美元），但未披露投资者的姓名。交叉融资通常会给创业企业更多的时间和资金来发展业务，以便首次公开募股 (IPO)。投资者通常会以折扣价完成交叉融资交易，同时在预期 IPO 中站稳脚跟。中国比亚迪超越特斯拉，成为纯电动汽车的最大制造商根据电动汽车公司投资者之一奇虎 360 技术公司的年度报告，Hozon 在 2022 年报告净亏损 69 亿元人民币，比上一年 29 亿元人民币的亏损增加了 138%。周表示，该公司在 2026 年的目标是销售 100 万辆电动汽车，其中包括 40 万辆在海外销售。他还表示，该公司计划在中东、非洲和南美洲等市场建设工厂。
  • 摘要：中国电动汽车初创公司 Hozon New Energy Automobile 计划在 2024 年大幅提高海外销量。
  • 主题：Hozon 的全球扩张战略，以应对国内增长放缓和中国电动汽车市场激烈的竞争。
  • 观点：Hozon 对中国制造的电动汽车的全球吸引力的信心，以及其为全球受众设计和制造电动汽车的目标。
  • 主要信息：Hozon 在 2024 年海外市场的销售目标为 10 万辆；泰国和印度尼西亚组装厂的运营；计划在中东、非洲和南美洲建设工厂；Hozon 计划在 2026 年销售 100 万辆电动汽车，其中包括 40 万辆在海外销售。

单词：

  • drive (v.) - /draɪv/ 驾驶，驱动。

    原文例句：The plant, with an annual capacity of 20,000 units, produces right-hand-drive versions of Neta vehicles.

    例句讲解：这个单词来源于古英语drīfan，表示“使移动，驱使，驾驶”。在这个例句中，它指的是Neta汽车的右舵版本，即方向盘在汽车的右侧。

  • supplier (n.) - /səˈplaɪ.ər/ 供应商，提供者。

    原文例句：Meanwhile, in the first three months of the year, Toyota maintained its position as the top supplier of passenger cars in the country, selling 11,388 units, a 2.8 per cent increase year on year.

    例句讲解：这个单词来源于古法语supleier，意为“提供，供给”。在这个例句中，它指的是 passenger cars 的供应商，即汽车的提供者。

词组：

  • in terms of - 就……而言，从……方面来说。

    原文例句：However, this did not prevent China from becoming the top importer in terms of the number of vehicles purchased.

    例句讲解：这个词组是由in（在……里面），terms（条件，条款）和of（属于，关于）构成的，表示“按照某种标准或角度来衡量或评价”。在这个例句中，它表示在购买的汽车数量方面，中国成为最大的进口国。

  • drive (v.) - /draɪv/ 驾驶，驱动。

    原文例句：The plant, with an annual capacity of 20,000 units, produces right-hand-drive versions of Neta vehicles.

    例句讲解：这个单词来源于古英语drīfan，表示“使移动，驱使，驾驶”。在这个例句中，它指的是Neta汽车的右舵版本，即方向盘在汽车的右侧。

  • supplier (n.) - /səˈplaɪ.ər/ 供应商，提供者。

    原文例句：Meanwhile, in the first three months of the year, Toyota maintained its position as the top supplier of passenger cars in the country, selling 11,388 units

    • The Shanghai-based maker of Neta-branded cars aims to deliver 100,000 units in 60 overseas markets this year, mainly in Southeast Asia
    • Company started assembling vehicles at its first overseas factory in Thailand in November, about two months ahead of schedule

    Chinese electric vehicle (EV) start-up Hozon New Energy Automobile expects its sales outside mainland China to jump five-fold in 2024 as the country’s increasingly confident carmakers look to international sales to counter slowing growth at home.

    The Shanghai-based maker of Neta-branded cars, aims to deliver a total 100,000 units in 60 overseas markets this year, mainly in Southeast Asia, as it starts operations of assembly plants in Thailand and Indonesia, according to vice-president Zhou Jiang.

    At that level, overseas sales would account for a third of Hozon’s total deliveries in 2024, which are likely to hit 300,000 units, he said.

    “Overall, Chinese-made electric cars are well received by customers around the world,” he said in a media briefing on Thursday. “Moreover, we are confident of our company’s global perspective with the goal of designing and manufacturing EVs for all the people.”

    At the end of November, Hozon, also known as Neta Auto, started assembling vehicles at its first overseas factory in Thailand, about two months ahead of schedule. The plant, with an annual capacity of 20,000 units, produces right-hand-drive versions of Neta vehicles.

    Hozon’s second assembly facility outside China will be operational by the second quarter, Zhou said.

    “Owing to a slowing domestic market, Chinese EV makers whose brands and vehicles can attract foreign buyers will step up their overseas expansion in the coming years,” said Eric Han, a ­senior ­manager at Suolei, an advisory firm in Shanghai. “Indeed, they enjoy a higher profit margin in other markets because of price competition at home.”

    Short sellers target BYD, world’s top EV maker, as rivalry intensifies

    Neta is a variation of the name Nezha, a protection deity in Chinese mythology. The brand falls into the category of budget EVs in China, aimed at middle- and low-income drivers who prefer battery-powered vehicles to cars powered by petrol-guzzling internal combustion engines.

    EV sales in mainland China are seen growing 20 per cent year on year in 2024, according to a Fitch Ratings’ report in November, slowing from the projected 30 per cent increase in 2023.

    With the EV market crowded with 200 players, a new round of price cuts is in effect, with top players like BYD, the world’s largest maker, and Xpeng offering discounts to lure buyers.

    China EVs: Xpeng and Li Auto roll out minivan models with focus on rich buyers

    Hozon delivered a total of 127,496 vehicles to domestic and overseas customers in 2023, down 16 per cent year on year.

    In August, the company announced it had raised 7 billion yuan (US$986 million) in a crossover financing deal, without disclosing the names of the investors.

    Crossover financing typically gives a start-up more time and capital to develop its business before an initial public offering (IPO). Investors normally close cross-financing deals at a discounted price while gaining a foothold in the prospective IPO.

    China’s BYD overtakes Tesla as largest maker of pure-electric vehicles

    Hozon reported a net loss of 6.9 billion yuan in 2022, 138 per cent wider than a 2.9 billion yuan loss in the previous year, according to the annual report of 360 Security Technology, one of the EV company’s investors.

    Zhou said the carmaker targets total sales of 1 million EVs in 2026, including 400,000 outside mainland China. It also plans to build plants in markets like the Middle East, Africa and South America, he said.
