  • 主题：中国已将目标锁定在2030年成为世界人工智能创新中心，并且在这一领域取得了重大进展。
  • 观点：香港可以通过提供人才和资金在中国的AI发展中发挥作用。
  • 主要信息：中国AI市场的快速增长；该国大量的人工智能企业和研究论文；支持人工智能发展的政策和基础设施；香港在提供人才和资金方面的潜在作用。

单词：

  • capacity (n.) - (尤指机器的)容量，能力。

    原文例句：One reason is that AI is a foundational technology with the capacity to increase productivity, boost competitiveness and help solve social challenges.

    例句讲解：这个单词来源于Latin，由capere（接受，采取）和-ity（状态或质量）组成，表示“能力，容纳或接受的能力，量”。在这个例句中，它指的是人工智能作为一项基础技术，有能力提高生产力，增强竞争力，并帮助解决社会挑战。

  • contribute (v.) - (为某事)做出贡献，提供（钱或帮助）。

    原文例句：Hong Kong can contribute by providing AI talent and funding.

    例句讲解：这个单词来源于Latin，由con-（在一起）和tribuere（给予或分配）组成，表示“做出贡献，给予或提供”。在这个例句中，它指的是香港可以通过提供人工智能人才和资金来做出贡献。

词组：

  • achieve dominance - 获得支配地位，取得优势。

    原文例句：Why are nations racing to achieve AI dominance?

    例句讲解：这个词组是由achieve（达到，实现）和dominance（优势，统治地位）构成的，表示“获得支配地位，取得优势”。在这个例句中，它表示各国竞相争夺人工智能的优势地位。

句子：

  • Meanwhile, Hong Kong has a key role to play in China’s AI development. - 与此同时，香港在中国的人工智能发展中发挥着关键作用。

    句子分析：这是一个简单句，主语是Hong Kong，谓语是has a key role to play，宾语是in China’s AI development。key role to play是一个固定短语，表示“关键作用”。China’s AI development是一个名词短语，表示“中国的人工智能发展”。这个句子的意思是说，香港在中国的人工智能发展中发挥着关键作用。

语法：

  • 分词作主语 - 分词可以作为主语，表示执行动作或处于某种状态的人或物。

    原文例句：According to the State Council’s 2017 guidelines, AI should be used to promote China’s technology, economy and social welfare, maintain national security and contribute to the world.

    语法讲解：在这个例句中，promote China’s technology, economy and social welfare、maintain national security和contribute to the world都是分词短语作主语。这三个分词短语分别表示“促进中国科技、经济和社会福利”、“维护国家安全”和“为世界做出贡献”。

  • 倒装句 - 所谓倒装句，就是故意把主语和谓语的位置倒过来的一种句子。

    原文例句：According to the 2023 AI Index Report by the Stanford Institute for Human-Centred Artificial Intelligence, global investment in AI has significantly increased over the last decade.

    语法讲解：在这个例句中，谓语global investment in AI has significantly increased被放在了主语According to the 2023 AI Index Report by the Stanford Institute for Human-Centred Artificial Intelligence之前。这种情况就是所谓的倒装句语序，即把谓语和主语的位置颠倒过来，目的是为了强调句子的某个成分，比如时间、地点、方式等。

  • China’s AI market, firms and tech are growing strongly, while the regulatory climate is maturing. Hong Kong can contribute by providing AI talent and funding

If we are in the midst of a global race for artificial intelligence (AI) breakthroughs, China is definitely a key player. While 2023 has been a year of AI hype – especially for generative AI, amid the popularity of ChatGPT – the industry has been of interest to most countries for years and will only become more important.

According to the 2023 AI Index Report by the Stanford Institute for Human-Centred Artificial Intelligence, global investment in AI has significantly increased over the last decade. By 2022, private investment in AI had grown to 18 times greater than in 2013.

Back in 2017, China made AI a national priority, stating its ambition to become “the world’s premier artificial intelligence innovation centre” by 2030.

According to the State Council’s 2017 guidelines, AI should be used to promote China’s technology, economy and social welfare, maintain national security and contribute to the world. The guidelines also said: “AI should be applied in the public service and social management to build a safer, more comfortable and convenient society.”

Why are nations racing to achieve AI dominance? One reason is that AI is a foundational technology with the capacity to increase productivity, boost competitiveness and help solve social challenges.

So what does the AI industry in China look like? According to a recent Nikkei study, “China is the undisputed champion in artificial intelligence research papers … far surpassing the US in both quantity and quality”.

China’s AI market is projected to reach US$38.89 billion this year, and will grow by a compound annual rate of 18 per cent to reach US$104.7 billion by 2030. This is less than the US market, the world’s largest at a projected US$106.5 billion this year.

In addition, China has more than 4,300 AI enterprises and at least 238 large language models (LLMs) – deep-learning AI algorithms based on very large data sets – with tech giants such as Baidu, Alibaba (owner of the South China Morning Post) Tencent, Meituan and iFlyTek all venturing into the field.

It is fair to say China can indeed become a world leader in AI by 2030. This is especially given its number of AI companies, number of people working in them, advanced AI infrastructure and supportive policies.

Furthermore, China has 975 million smartphone users, by far the highest in any country, meaning it generates a vast amount of digital information – and data plays a paramount role in developing AI.

From a regulatory perspective, China has taken a further step towards digitalisation and innovation. At the third Belt and Road Forum for International Cooperation, President Xi Jinping proposed the Global AI Governance Initiative for countries participating in the Belt and Road Initiative.

The initiative calls for a “people-centred” approach to AI (i.e., developing AI for the good of humanity and its progress), more inclusiveness and fairness in AI development so countries can benefit regardless of their political or economic situation, testing and assessment systems based on AI risk levels, and regulation reform to protect privacy and data security.

Even though Global AI Governance Initiative is not the first multilateral forum on AI, it is undoubtedly one of the bigger ones, with potential implications for the AI regulatory scene across the globe.

How Hong Kong can play a role in preventing AI Armageddon

Meanwhile, Hong Kong has a key role to play in China’s AI development. Financial Secretary Paul Chan Mo-po has said the city can contribute by providing talent and funding.

At the World Artificial Intelligence Conference in Shanghai in July, Chan said Hong Kong had advantages when it came to attracting talent in the current geopolitical landscape: “Our universities have brought together scientific researchers from the mainland and around the world, and the Hong Kong government has given a lot of policy and financial support in the past few years.”

Moreover, Chan added, the Greater Bay Area has formed “the whole industrial chain of AI from research to market application”.

To sum up, China will probably become the global AI leader and Hong Kong has a role to play in this. China’s AI industry is powerful and will keep on growing. While it is still too early to say if the Global AI Governance Initiative will be a success, it is relevant that China starts leveraging the Belt and Road Initiative.

Dr Oriol Caudevilla is an honorary fellow at the Asian Institute of International Financial Law at the University of Hong Kong and a board director at the Global Impact FinTech Forum. The views do not necessarily reflect those of any of the organisations the author collaborates with

item.title: Alibaba reduces stake in GoGoX amid Hong Kong logistics services firm’s mounting losses, as it faces cutthroat competition on the mainland
item.description:
Summary：

  • Alibaba has further reduced its stake in logistics service provider GoGoX Holdings due to cutthroat competition and regulatory pressure in the mainland's intracity delivery courier market.
  • Alibaba's stake in GoGoX has decreased to 8.89% from 12.23% in mid-2023.
  • GoGoX has faced losses since 2018 owing to fierce competition and its international expansion.
  • GoGoX saw its market value shrink by more than 90% since its Hong Kong trading debut in June 2022.
  • GoGoX is expected to remain in the red this year, but it narrowed its losses in the first half of 2023.
  • Alibaba's partial divestment in GoGoX comes amid preparations for the IPO of its logistics arm Cainiao Smart Logistics Network.

总结：

  • 阿里巴巴进一步减持物流服务提供商GoGoX控股的股份，原因是面临国内货运市场激烈的竞争和监管压力。
  • 阿里巴巴所持有的GoGoX的股份从2023年中期的12.23%下降至8.89%。
  • 自2018年以来，由于激烈的竞争和国际扩张，GoGoX一直陷入亏损。
  • 自2022年6月在港交所首次亮相以来，GoGoX的市值已缩水超过90%。
  • 预计GoGoX今年仍将亏损，但2023年上半年亏损有所收窄。
  • 阿里巴巴在GoGoX的阶段性减持，是为了筹备物流臂菜鸟网络的首次公开募股（IPO）。

单词：

  • cutthroat (adj.) - /ˈkʌtˌθrəʊt/ 非常激烈的，残酷的。

    原文例句：Alibaba Group Holding has further reduced its stake in Hong Kong-listed logistics service provider GoGoX Holdings, which is facing cutthroat competition and regulatory pressure in the mainland’s intracity delivery courier market.

    例句讲解：这个词由cut（切，割）和throat（喉咙）组成，表示“割断喉咙”，引申为“非常激烈的，残酷的”。在这个例句中，它指的是物流服务提供商GoGoX Holdings在大陆城市内部送货快递市场中面临非常激烈的竞争和监管压力。

  • intracity (adj.) - /ˈɪntrəˌsɪti/ 城市内部的。

    原文例句：Alibaba Group Holding has further reduced its stake in Hong Kong-listed logistics service provider GoGoX Holdings, which is facing cutthroat competition and regulatory pressure in the mainland’s intracity delivery courier market.

    例句讲解：这个词由intra（ внутри）和city（城市）组成，表示“在城市内部”。在这个例句中，它指的是物流服务提供商GoGoX Holdings在大陆城市内部送货快递市场中面临非常激烈的竞争和监管压力。

  • courier (n.) - /ˈkʌrɪər/ 快递员，信使。

    原文例句：GoGoX is competing in a crowded on-demand cargo delivery services market on the mainland, where its hometown rival Lalatech Holdings operates Huolala.

    例句讲解：这个词来源于古法语的correor（信使），表示“快递员，信使”。在这个例句中，它指的是物流服务提供商GoGoX在大陆城市内部送货快递市场中面临非常激烈的竞争，其家乡的竞争对手Lalatech Holdings经营着Huolala。

词组：

  • narrow down (v.) - /næroʊ ˈdaʊn/ 缩小，限制。

    原文例句：The company narrowed its losses to 642.9 million yuan (US$90.37 million) in the first half of 2023, from 1.05 billion yuan in the same period in 2022.

    例句讲解：这个词组由narrow（狭窄）和down（向下）组成，表示“变窄，变小”。在这个例句中，它指的是该公司2023年上半年的亏损从2022年同期的10.5亿人民币收窄至6.429亿人民币。

  • similar to - 类似于，相似于。

    原文例句：“This is still a market with huge demand and many opportunities even with the price wars, similar to those in the bike-sharing and ride-hailing sectors,” Zhang said.

    例句讲解：这个词组由similar（相似的）和to（到）组成，表示“与……相似，与……类似”。在这个例句中，它指的是即使存在价格战，这个市场仍然有巨大的需求和许多机会，类似于共享单车和叫车服务行业。

句子：

  • Alibaba logistics spin-off Cainiao to boost overseas position with Best buyout - 阿里巴巴物流子公司菜鸟收购百世以提升海外地位。

    句子分析：这是一个名词性复合句，主句是Cainiao to boost overseas position with Best buyout，其中主语是Cainiao，谓语是to boost海外地位，宾语是Best buyout。Alibaba logistics spin-off是一个名词性短语，作主语Cainiao的定语，表示阿里巴巴的物流子公司菜鸟。with Best buyout是一个介词短语，作状语，表示通过收购百世来提升海外地位。这个句子的意思是说，阿里巴巴的物流子公司菜鸟收购百世以提升海外地位。

语法：

  • 非谓语动词作主语 - 可以用在句子中作主语。

    原文例句：Following those moves, the biggest shareholder of GoGoX remains billionaire Yao Jinbo – the founder, chairman and chief executive of mainland Chinese online classifieds giant 58.com – with a 38.69 per cent share.

    语法讲解：在这个例句中，Following those moves是一个非谓语动词短语，作主语，表示在那些举动之后。remains billionaire Yao Jinbo是谓语，其中remains是谓语动词，billionaire Yao Jinbo是主语。这个句子的意思是说，在那些举动之后，GoGoX的最大股东仍然是亿万富翁姚劲波——大陆在线分类广告巨头58.com的创始人、董事长兼首席执行官——持有38.69%的股份。

  • 倒装 - 把句子中通常在后面的成分提前到前面。

    原文例句：Still, GoGoX has recorded losses since 2018 owing to stiff competition on the mainland and its continued international expansion.

    语法讲解：在这个例句中，Still, GoGoX has recorded losses since 2018是一个倒装句，把通常在后面的成分Still提前到了前面。owing to stiff competition on the mainland and its continued international expansion是一个介词短语，作状语，表示由于大陆激烈的竞争和持续的国际扩张。这个句子的意思是说，自2018年以来，GoGoX一直亏损，原因是大陆激烈的竞争和持续的国际扩张。

  • Alibaba has cut its GoGoX stake four times over the past two months, leaving it with an 8.89 per cent equity holding as of December
  • GoGoX has recorded losses since 2018 owing to stiff competition on the mainland and its continued international expansion

Chinese e-commerce giant Alibaba Group Holding has further reduced its stake in Hong Kong-listed logistics service provider GoGoX Holdings, which is facing cutthroat competition and regulatory pressure in the mainland’s intracity delivery courier market.

Alibaba, which owns the South China Morning Post, has cut its GoGoX stake four times over the past two months, slashing its equity holding to 8.89 per cent as of late December from 12.23 per cent in mid-2023, according to Hong Kong stock exchange records.

Following those moves, the biggest shareholder of GoGoX remains billionaire Yao Jinbo – the founder, chairman and chief executive of mainland Chinese online classifieds giant 58.com – with a 38.69 per cent share. GoGoX co-founder Chen Xiaohua, with a 5.95 per cent stake, retains his position as the company’s third-biggest shareholder.

Founded as GoGoVan in Hong Kong in 2013, GoGoX became the city’s first unicorn in 2017 after its merger with short-distance freight service platform operator 58 Suyun. Still, GoGoX has recorded losses since 2018 owing to stiff competition on the mainland and its continued international expansion.

GoGoX, which operates as Kuaigou Dache on the mainland, has seen its market value shrink by more than 90 per cent since its Hong Kong trading debut in June 2022. Its share price closed up 6.8 per cent to HK$0.63 on Thursday.

The company – which expects to remain in the red this year, according to its 2022 prospectus – narrowed its losses to 642.9 million yuan (US$90.37 million) in the first half of 2023, from 1.05 billion yuan in the same period in 2022.

GoGoX also went through a major management reshuffle in December, as founder Chen resigned from his chairman role. The company tapped Steven Lam Hoi-yuen, another co-founder and the co-chief executive of GoGoX, as its new chairman.

Hangzhou-based Alibaba’s partial divestment initiative at GoGoX comes amid its preparations for the initial public offering (IPO) of Cainiao Smart Logistics Network, which submitted its A1 filing to the Hong Kong stock exchange last September.

Cainiao aims to raise at least US$1 billion, subject to market conditions, according to sources cited in a Post report that month.

Alibaba is trying to stop the bleeding with its stake cut, as its initial goal with the GoGoX investment was to gain financial returns through the listing and create synergy with its own services, according to Zhang Yi, founder and chief analyst at Guangdong-based consultancy iiMedia.

“This is still a market with huge demand and many opportunities even with the price wars, similar to those in the bike-sharing and ride-hailing sectors,” Zhang said. “So the bigger problem is more likely to lie within the operation of GoGoX, which will need revolutionary measures to reverse its losses.”

At present, GoGoX is competing in a crowded on-demand cargo delivery services market on the mainland, where its hometown rival Lalatech Holdings operates Huolala. Competition has become more intense in recent years after traditional logistics firms and ride-hailing companies also set up similar app-based courier delivery operations.

Chinese ride-hailing giant Didi Chuxing, for example, started its own intracity freight service in 2020 and launched its autonomous trucking business Kargobot in April last year. Full Truck Alliance, known as China’s “Uber for trucks” and focused on long-haul logistics services, in April launched its Sheng Sheng brand dedicated to same-city delivery.

Alibaba logistics spin-off Cainiao to boost overseas position with Best buyout

Huolala currently leads the mainland’s intracity courier delivery services market with a 61 per cent share, according to Frost & Sullivan data cited in the prospectus of Lalatech, which is eyeing a Hong Kong IPO.

Similar to on-demand services like ride hailing, the early stage of competition in intracity freight services has relied heavily on subsidies for users.

That “cash-burning” business model, however, has faced increased scrutiny from regulators, who recently summoned Lalatech for talks regarding drivers’ rights and unfair price cuts.

GoGoX and other courier delivery services providers have also received “reminders” from regulators about their operations in the past year.

item.title: Amid US tech war, Premier Li Qiang urges China to focus on application of core technologies
item.description:
Summary：

李强总理本周对中部湖北省进行了为期两天的访问，期间走访了高校和制造企业，包括半导体、激光和化工企业。他呼吁在中美科技战的大背景下，加强产学研合作。
  • Abstract: 李总理考察湖北省期间强调加强产学研合作，推进科技自立，加快经济复苏，提振市场信心。
  • Theme: 中美科技战背景下，加强产学研合作，推动科技自立，助推经济复苏和市场信心。
  • Viewpoint: 产学研合作是科技创新的关键，需通过精准施策，优化政策，促进科技成果转化为市场产出。
  • Main information: 李总理视察高校和企业，敦促加强产学研合作，以新兴技术驱动生产力，加快经济复苏；湖北省作为长江经济带的核心区域，需要加强产学研合作，推动科研成果转化；中美科技战背景下，中国不断寻求突破关键技术制约，实现科技自立；李总理还视察了水利项目和化工企业，倡导发展循环经济，实现绿色发展。

English summary：

Premier Li Qiang visited universities as well as semiconductor, laser and chemical manufacturers during a two-day visit to the central Hubei province this week. He called for “more and better” market applications of core technologies amid China’s self-reliance drive, urging for improved collaboration between academia and business amid the ongoing tech war with the United States. Li stressed the need to accelerate the development of productivity driven by emerging technologies and kick-start a robust economic performance for the year. He emphasized the importance of enhancing collaboration between academia and business through precise and supportive measures to facilitate the transformation of scientific research into market production.
  • Abstract: Li's visit focused on promoting technological self-reliance, collaboration between academia and industry, and stimulating economic growth amid the ongoing US-China tech war.
  • Theme: China's efforts to enhance its technological capabilities, bridge the gap between research and market applications, and bolster economic recovery.
  • Viewpoint: Li emphasized the significance of collaboration, innovation, and market-oriented research to address the challenges posed by the tech war and achieve sustainable economic growth.
  • Main information: Li's tour included visits to universities, tech companies, and industrial sites, highlighting the need for improved cooperation between academia and industry, stronger investment in emerging technologies, and the promotion of green development and circular economy practices.

单词：

  • collaboration (n.) - /kəˌlæbəˈreɪʃən/ 协作，合作。

    原文例句：Premier Li Qiang called for improved collaboration between academia and business amid the ongoing tech war with the United States.

    例句讲解：这个单词是由co-（共同）和labor（工作）构成的，表示“共同工作，合作”。在这个例句中，它指的是李总理呼吁在中美科技战的背景下加强产学研合作。

  • semiconductor (n.) - /ˌsemɪkənˈdʌktər/ 半导体。

    原文例句：Premier Li Qiang visited a university, as well as semiconductor, laser and chemical manufacturers, during a two-day visit to the central Hubei province this week.

    例句讲解：这个单词是由semi-（半）和conductor（导体）构成的，表示“半导体”。在这个例句中，它指的是李总理在湖北省考察了半导体制造企业。

词组：

  • amid the ongoing tech war - 在正在进行的技术战中。

    原文例句：Premier Li Qiang called for improved collaboration between academia and business amid the ongoing tech war with the United States.

    例句讲解：这个词组是由amid（在……中）和the ongoing tech war（正在进行的技术战）构成的，表示“在正在进行的技术战中”。在这个例句中，它表示李总理在中美科技战的背景下呼吁加强产学研合作。

  • more and better - 更多、更好的。

    原文例句：Premier Li Qiang pushed for “more and better” market applications of core technologies amid China’s self-reliance drive.

    例句讲解：这个词组是由more（更多）和better（更好）构成的，表示“更多、更好的”。在这个例句中，它表示李总理在推动中国科技自立的过程中，强调要加强核心技术的市场应用，做到“更多、更好”。

句子：

  • He called for improved collaboration between academia and business amid the ongoing tech war with the United States. - 他呼吁在中美科技战的背景下加强产学研合作。

    句子分析：这是一个简单句，主语是He，谓语是called，宾语是for improved collaboration between academia and business amid the ongoing tech war with the United States。这个句子表示李总理呼吁在中美科技战的背景下加强产学研合作。这个句子的结构是比较简单的，但是其中的几个单词和短语都比较重要。例如，collaboration（合作）是一个比较重要的单词，它表示“共同工作，合作”；academia（学术界）是一个比较重要的短语，它表示“高校和科研机构”；business（企业）是一个比较重要的单词，它表示“企业和公司”；amid（在……中）是一个比较重要的介词，它表示“在……中”；the ongoing tech war（正在进行的技术战）是一个比较重要的短语，它表示“中美科技战”。

语法：

  • 强调句型 - 表示强调句子的某个成分，强调的成分要放在句首，主语和助动词之间。

    原文例句：We must expedite the development of productivity driven by emerging technology, and kick-start a robust economic start of the year.

    语法讲解：这是一个强调句型的句子，强调的成分是We，它放在了句首，主语是we，助动词是must，谓语是expedite the development of productivity driven by emerging technology, and kick-start a robust economic start of the year。这个句子的意思是，我们必须加快新兴技术驱动的生产力发展，并启动一个强劲的经济开局。

  • 倒装句型 - 表示强调特殊情况，将谓语动词提前到主语之前。

    原文例句：Given the escalating containment efforts by the United States, Beijing is continually seeking to tackle choke points with home-grown technology.

    语法讲解：这是一个倒装句型的句子，将谓语动词is continually seeking提前到了主语Beijing之前。这个句子的意思是，鉴于美国不断升级的围堵措施，北京一直在寻求用自主技术解决关键环节的问题。

  • Premier Li Qiang visited a university, as well as semiconductor, laser and chemical manufacturers, during a two-day visit to the central province of Hubei this week
  • He called for improved collaboration between academia and business amid the ongoing tech war with the United States

Premier Li Qiang pushed for “more and better” market applications of core technologies amid China’s self-reliance drive during a two-day tour of Hubei province this week, with the world’s second-largest economy in urgent need of stabilisation to quell investor concerns and lift market confidence.

“We must expedite the development of productivity driven by emerging technology, and kick-start a robust economic start of the year,” he said in a statement following the tour of the central province on Tuesday and Wednesday, according to the official Xinhua News Agency.

Hubei is a key part of the Yangtze River Economic Belt, which is one of President Xi Jinping’s key regional development strategies. It includes 11 provinces and municipalities, and accounts for over 40 per cent of China’s population and economic size.

“We need to improve collaboration between academia and business, by introducing more precise and supportive measures, thus fluidly turning scientific research into market production,” the premier said after visiting HGLaser Engineering and semiconductor manufacturer Yangtze Memory Technologies Corporation (YMTC) in the provincial capital of Wuhan.

Time to open its doors wider, or will China fall into a middle-technology trap?

Given the escalating containment efforts by the United States, Beijing is continually seeking to tackle choke points with home-grown technology.

Development was also mentioned as China’s biggest priority for 2024 at the tone-setting central economic work conference in mid-December.

HGLaser introduced China’s first fully domestically produced chip-cutting machine in July, according to the WeChat account of Donghu New Technology Development Zone in Wuhan.

But unlike China’s leading memory chip maker, YMTC, HGLaser has not been sanctioned by the US. YMTC was added to the US trade blacklist in December 2022.

During his two-day tour, Li also inspected Wuhan University’s laboratory on high-resolution Earth observation and the BeiDou navigation system.

The home-grown BeiDou system, which is China’s equivalent to the US’ Global Positioning System (GPS), can be applied to agriculture, forestry and meteorology.

China, though, has long suffered from loose cooperation between academia, including universities and research institutes, and enterprises focused on market applications.

The cooperation issues include poor communication and insufficient resource sharing, which creates obstacles affecting the transformation of inventions in China.

‘Important milestone’: China’s GPS-like BeiDou navigation system hits new height

As of the end of 2022, only 3.9 per cent of inventions at Chinese universities were industrialised, according to the latest data available by the China National Intellectual Property Administration, compared to around 50 per cent in the US.

Li also visited water conservancy projects and a chemical company focusing on green development in Yichang, as well as a battery industrial estate set up by Guangdong Brunp Recycling Technology, a subsidiary under China’s leading lithium battery maker, Contemporary Amperex Technology (CATL).

CATL is a supplier to several carmakers, including Tesla, BMW and Volkswagen.

The premier also encouraged companies to promote China’s sustainability by focusing on the circular economy to drive companies up the value chain.

The circular economy model seeks to minimise wasting resources and environmental impact by extending the life cycle of products.

item.title: PDD halts development of local services offering to avoid head-on competition with Meituan and Ele.me, report says
item.description:
Summary：

The Chinese e-commerce giant PDD has halted the development of its local life services offering due to intense competition in the market. With an estimated worth of 35 trillion yuan by 2025, the sector has attracted major players such as Meituan, Alibaba Group Holding, and ByteDance, leading PDD to refrain from direct confrontation.
  • Abstract: PDD's retreat from local life services due to market competition.
  • Theme: The intensifying rivalry among Chinese Big Tech firms in the local services market leads PDD to change strategy.
  • Viewpoint: The challenges faced by PDD in establishing a foothold in the local services market and the dynamic landscape of the industry.
  • Main information: PDD's initial plans for local services; the company's strengths and weaknesses in the market; the dominance of Meituan and other competitors; PDD's continued expansion overseas.

总结：

中国电商巨头拼多多因市场竞争激烈，已停止发展本地生活服务业务。该领域预计到2025年价值将达到35万亿元人民币，吸引了美团、阿里巴巴集团控股、字节跳动等巨头，导致拼多多选择避免正面交锋。
  • 摘要：拼多多因市场竞争退出本地生活服务领域。
  • 主题：中国互联网巨头在本地生活服务领域的竞争加剧，导致拼多多改变了战略。
  • 观点：拼多多在本地生活服务领域站稳脚跟所面临的挑战，以及行业格局的动态变化。
  • 主要信息：拼多多对本地生活的最初计划；公司在该领域的优势和劣势；美团等竞争对手的优势；拼多多继续在海外扩张。

单词：

  • rivalry (n.) - /ˈraɪv(ə)lri/ 竞争，敌对。

    原文例句：Chinese Big Tech firms have jostled for supremacy in a local services market expected to be worth 35 trillion yuan by 2025.

    例句讲解：Rivalry可以追溯到中世纪的rival，意思为竞争对手，敌对者。rivalry这个单词主要指“竞争，敌对”。在这个例句中，它的意思是中国科技巨头在预计2025年价值35万亿元人民币的地方服务市场上展开了激烈的竞争。

  • dominance (n.) - /ˈdɒmɪnəns/ 统治，支配。

    原文例句：Meituan, which merged with restaurant review site Dianping and bike-sharing start-up Mobike, currently leads the sector with a range of food delivery, taxi-ride and hotel reservation services.

    例句讲解：Dominance源于拉丁语dominari，意为统治，奴役。Dominance主要指“统治，支配”。在这个例句中，它的意思是美团通过与餐厅点评网站大众点评和共享单车创业公司摩拜单车的合并，目前在提供食品配送、出租车出行和酒店预订服务等一系列服务方面处于领先地位。

词组：

  • head-to-head rivalry - 正面较量，面对面的竞争。

    原文例句：PDD Holdings has halted work on its local life services offering, avoiding head-to-head rivalry with Meituan, Alibaba Group Holding and ByteDance.

    例句讲解：Head-to-head rivalry是一个形容词短语，Head-to-head表示“面对面的，正面相对的”，rivalry表示“竞争，敌对”。Head-to-head rivalry这个词组主要指“正面较量，面对面的竞争”。在这个例句中，它的意思是拼多多暂停了本地生活服务业务，避免与美团、阿里巴巴集团控股和字节跳动正面交锋。

句子：

  • PDD had “completely halted [development of] the local services business”, according to Chinese media outlet LatePost. - 根据中国媒体《晚点Post》，拼多多已“完全停止了本地生活服务业务的开发”。

    句子分析：这是一个陈述句，主语是PDD，谓语是had halted，宾语是development of the local services business。completely是一个副词，修饰halted，表示完全地。according to Chinese media outlet LatePost是一个介词短语，表示根据中国媒体《晚点Post》的报道。这个句子的意思是说，根据中国媒体《晚点Post》的报道，拼多多已经完全停止了本地生活服务业务的开发。

语法：

  • 过去完成时 - 表示在过去某个时间点之前已经完成的动作或状态。

    原文例句：PDD had leveraged Duoduo Maicai’s business development team of around 3,000 people to sign up bricks-and-mortar outlets, such as restaurants and tourist attractions, the report said.

    语法讲解：这是一个时态，结构是：had + been + 过去分词。其中had是have的过去式，been是be的过去分词，过去分词是动词的-ed形式。这种时态表示在过去某个时间点之前已经完成的动作或状态。在这个例句中，它表示拼多多利用多多买菜的约3000人的业务发展团队签约了实体店，例如餐馆和旅游景点，这一动作或状态发生在报道撰写之前。

  • PDD had planned to launch local services offering in February 2024 under its community group-buying unit Duoduo Maicai, report says
  • Chinese Big Tech firms including Meituan, Alibaba and TikTok owner ByteDance have jostled for supremacy in local services market

E-commerce giant PDD Holdings has halted work on its local life services offering, avoiding head-to-head rivalry with Meituan, Alibaba Group Holding and ByteDance, whose Douyin short video app has also dipped a toe into the sector.

PDD has “completely halted [development of] the local services business”, according to Chinese media outlet LatePost. PDD did not immediately respond to a request for comment.

PDD, whose market cap overtook Alibaba in November after the firm beat revenue estimates, had planned to launch the service – which facilitates in-store orders including hotel reservations and movie tickets – in February 2024 under its community group-buying unit Duoduo Maicai, LatePost reported. Alibaba owns the South China Morning Post.

PDD had leveraged Duoduo Maicai’s business development team of around 3,000 people to sign up bricks-and-mortar outlets, such as restaurants and tourist attractions, the report said.

Amazon doubles down on China e-commerce strategy as Shein, Temu gain traction

However, PDD’s management has not been completely satisfied with the performance of Duoduo Maicai, which was established in 2020 in the midst of the Covid-19 pandemic. It enables residents in a community to purchase groceries and other daily essentials in bulk, bringing prices down.

Although the unit has become an industry leader, it is not profitable due to low gross margins, according to the LatePost report, which cited a PDD executive. Duoduo Maicai is nevertheless expected to remain operational despite the halting of local life services, according to Chinese news portal Sina.

Chinese Big Tech firms including Meituan, Alibaba and TikTok owner ByteDance have jostled for supremacy in a local services market expected to be worth 35 trillion yuan (US$4.9 trillion) by 2025, according to estimates by market intelligence firm iResearch.

Meituan, which merged with restaurant review site Dianping and bike-sharing start-up Mobike, currently leads the sector with a range of food delivery, taxi-ride and hotel reservation services.

Alibaba has been seeking to catch up with the merger of its Koubei restaurant rating service and navigation app Amap. Alibaba’s local services segment also runs food delivery unit Ele.me, grocery delivery service Taoxianda, and online travel platform Fliggy.

ByteDance’s Douyin, the Chinese version of TikTok, has leveraged its more than 600 million daily active users to make aggressive moves in segments of on-demand e-commerce. The company set up a centre dedicated to developing local services in 2020.

Abandoning the local services market comes as PDD continues to expand aggressively overseas with its Temu app, now available in the United States, Japan and several other markets. The budget shopping platform helped drive an almost doubling of PDD’s third-quarter revenue to 68.8 billion yuan.

item.title: Microsoft to show off Copilot AI key for Windows keyboards at CES, in first change to layout since 1994
item.description:
English Summary：

  • Microsoft is introducing a Copilot key to Windows keyboards to allow users to access its AI assistant.
  • The Copilot key will be located to the right of the space bar, making it easily accessible for users.
  • The new key is a testament to Microsoft's commitment to artificial intelligence and its integration into Windows.
  • Microsoft envisions 2024 as "the year of the AI PC," with a focus on incorporating AI technology into various products.
  • The company has been retooling its products around AI tech, including Windows, Office, Bing search, and customer and finance products.
  • Microsoft's partnership with OpenAI and investment in its GPT-4 technology play a significant role in its AI endeavors.
  • Despite the introduction of AI features, Microsoft's push into AI services has yet to boost sales, suggesting a need for further enhancements.
  • Microsoft's efforts to integrate AI into hardware and silicon may lead to pressure on consumers to upgrade as the technology evolves.

中文总结：

  • 微软将在 Windows 键盘上添加一个 Copilot 键，允许用户立即调出其人工智能助手。
  • Copilot 键将位于空格键的右侧，方便用户轻松访问。
  • 这个新按键证明了微软对人工智能的承诺，以及将其集成到 Windows 中的决心。
  • 微软设想 2024 年是“AI PC 之年”，重点将人工智能技术融入各种产品中。
  • 该公司一直在围绕人工智能技术对其产品进行改造，包括 Windows、Office、Bing 搜索以及客户和金融产品。
  • 微软与 OpenAI 的合作以及对其实 GPT-4 技术的投资在其人工智能努力中发挥着重要作用。
  • 尽管引入了人工智能功能，但微软进军人工智能服务领域并未提振销量，这表明需要进一步改进。
  • 微软努力将人工智能集成到硬件和硅中可能会给消费者带来升级压力，因为该技术不断发展。

单词：

  • Copilot (n.) - 副驾驶员，辅助飞行员。

    原文例句：Microsoft is adding a button to the Windows keyboard to activate its AI Copilot service.

    例句讲解：Copilot 在这里指的是微软的人工智能助手，它可以帮助用户完成各种任务，比如创建图像、撰写电子邮件和总结文本。

  • retool (v.) - 改造，更新。

    原文例句：Microsoft has spent the past year retooling its biggest products around AI tech that can generate new content.

    例句讲解：Retool 在这里指的是微软对旗下产品的改造，使其能够更好地利用人工智能技术来生成新的内容。

  • seamless (adj.) - 无缝的，流畅的。

    原文例句：“AI will be seamlessly woven into Windows from the system, to the silicon, to the hardware,” Microsoft’s consumer chief marketing officer, Yusuf Mehdi, said in a blog announcing the change.

    例句讲解：Seamlessly 在这里指的是人工智能技术将与 Windows 系统、硅芯片和硬件无缝集成，从而为用户提供流畅、自然的使用体验。

词组：

  • the year of the AI PC - AI PC 之年。

    原文例句：Microsoft sees 2024 as ‘the year of the AI PC’.

    例句讲解：“The year of the AI PC”指的是微软将 2024 年视为“AI PC 之年”，这表明微软将重点关注将人工智能技术融入个人电脑。

  • weave into - 融入，编织到。

    原文例句：“AI will be seamlessly woven into Windows from the system, to the silicon, to the hardware,” Microsoft’s consumer chief marketing officer, Yusuf Mehdi, said in a blog announcing the change.

    例句讲解：“Weave into”在这里指的是人工智能技术将与 Windows 系统、硅芯片和硬件无缝集成，就像编织在一起一样。

句子：

  • Microsoft’s Copilot key will be available this month on new Windows 11 computers. - 微软的 Copilot 键将于本月在新的 Windows 11 电脑上提供。

    • 句子解析：这是一个简单的句子，主语是 Microsoft’s Copilot key，谓语是 will be available，宾语是 new Windows 11 computers。句子说明了微软的 Copilot 键将于本月在新的 Windows 11 电脑上提供。

  • Microsoft sees 2024 as ‘the year of the AI PC’ and has spent the past year retooling its biggest products around AI tech that can generate new content. - 微软将 2024 年视为“AI PC 之年”，过去一年一直在围绕能够生成新内容的人工智能技术改造其最受欢迎的产品。

    • 句子解析：这是一个复合句，由两个简单句组成。第一个简单句的主语是 Microsoft，谓语是 sees，宾语是 2024 as ‘the year of the AI PC’。第二个简单句的主语是 Microsoft，谓语是 has spent，宾语是 the past year retooling its biggest products around AI tech that can generate new content。句子说明了微软将 2024 年视为“AI PC 之年”，过去一年一直在围绕能够生成新内容的人工智能技术改造其最受欢迎的产品。

语法：

  • 现在完成时 (Present Perfect Tense) - 表示从过去开始到现在已经完成或持续到现在的动作或状态。

    • 原文例句：Microsoft has spent the past year retooling its biggest products around AI tech that can generate new content. - 微软过去一年一直在围绕能够生成新内容的人工智能技术改造其最受欢迎的产品。

    语法讲解：在这个句子中，has spent 是现在完成时的形式，表示微软从过去开始到现在已经持续了一年的改造行动。这也是一个简单的句子，主语是 Microsoft，谓语是 has spent，宾语是 the past year retooling its biggest products around AI tech that can generate new content。句子说明了微软过去一年一直在围绕能够生成新内容的人工智能技术改造其最受欢迎的产品。

  • 被动语态 (Passive Voice) - 表示动作或状态由句子的主语承受。

    • 原文例句：The Redmond, Washington-based company sees 2024 as “the year of the AI PC”, according to Mehdi. - 总部位

    • The Copilot key, which will sit to the right of the space bar, is the first change to the Windows keyboard layout since Microsoft added the Start key
    • The tech giant sees 2024 as ‘the year of the AI PC’ and has spent the past year retooling its biggest products around AI tech that can generate new content

    Microsoft is adding a button to the Windows keyboard to activate its AI Copilot service, with the first devices to sport the new key available this month.

    The Copilot key, which will sit to the right of the space bar, is the first change to the Windows keyboard layout since Microsoft added the Windows/Start key in 1994, underscoring the company’s commitment to artificial intelligence. Microsoft’s hardware partners will show off Windows 11 computers with the Copilot button over the coming days at the CES technology conference and, over time, it will become a required feature.

    The short cut will help users create images, write emails and summarise text with the help of AI.

    “AI will be seamlessly woven into Windows from the system, to the silicon, to the hardware,” Microsoft’s consumer chief marketing officer, Yusuf Mehdi, said in a blog announcing the change.

    Microsoft touts booming enterprise AI demand in Hong Kong amid cloud push

    The Redmond, Washington-based company sees 2024 as “the year of the AI PC”, according to Mehdi, mirroring the budding trend among smartphone makers to tout their latest models as “AI phones”. Those labels don’t carry much weight by themselves, but Microsoft has spent the past year retooling its biggest products around AI tech that can generate new content from massive data sets. That list now includes Windows, Office, Bing search, security software and customer and finance products. The work heavily leverages the GPT-4 technology from OpenAI, in which Microsoft has invested US$13 billion.

    For device makers, Microsoft’s push into AI services has not yet translated into a boost for sales, as the novel Copilot features are being rolled out to new and existing devices alike. Mehdi’s promise of weaving AI into hardware and silicon may signal more pressure on consumers to upgrade as Microsoft evolves and improves its AI proposition.

item.title: Chinese search engine giant Baidu to donate quantum computing facility to state-backed lab in similar move to Alibaba
item.description:
Summary：

Chinese tech giants Baidu and Alibaba are donating their quantum computing research facilities to research institutions, a move that reflects the intense competition in the country's artificial intelligence (AI) race. Baidu is donating its facility to the Beijing Academy of Quantum Information Sciences (BAQIS), while Alibaba donated its lab to Zhejiang University last year. Both companies aim to contribute to the advancement of quantum computing and foster collaboration in the field.
  • Abstract: Chinese tech giants contribute quantum computing research facilities to research institutions.
  • Theme: Baidu and Alibaba's donations signal the intensifying competition in China's AI race.
  • Viewpoint: Quantum computing's potential to revolutionize various industries and the strategic importance of fostering research in this field.
  • Main information: Baidu's donation of its quantum computing facility to BAQIS; Alibaba's previous donation of its quantum lab to Zhejiang University; the significance of quantum computing in solving complex problems beyond the capabilities of traditional computers.

总结：

中国科技巨头百度和阿里巴巴正在将其量子计算研究设施捐赠给科研机构，此举反映了该国人工智能（AI）领域日益激烈的竞争。百度将自己的设施捐赠给北京量子信息科学研究院（BAQIS），而阿里巴巴去年将其实验室捐赠给了浙江大学。两家公司均旨在为量子计算的发展做出贡献，并促进该领域的合作。
  • 摘要：中国科技巨头为科研机构贡献量子计算研究设施。
  • 主题：百度和阿里巴巴的捐赠标志着中国人工智能领域竞争的加剧。
  • 观点：量子计算的潜力能够彻底改变各个行业，以及在该领域促进研究的重要战略意义。
  • 主要信息：百度将量子计算设施捐赠给BAQIS；阿里巴巴之前将量子实验室捐赠给浙江大学；量子计算在解决传统计算机无法解决的复杂问题中的重要性。

单词：

  • quantum computing (n.) - 量子计算

    原文例句：Although quantum computers are not designed to replace traditional computers, they are able to solve very complex statistical problems via simultaneous multiple calculations, making them much faster.

    例句讲解：这个术语是指一种利用量子力学原理来进行计算的计算方式，这种计算方式具有比传统计算机更快的速度和更强的计算能力。

  • intellectual property (n.) - 知识产权

    原文例句：In March last year, Baidu and BAQIS jointly launched the country’s first quantum computing intellectual property (IP) alliance, with the goal of facilitating easier IP cross-licensing and innovation in the industry.

    例句讲解：这个词组是指由法律所保护的对象，如版权、商标、专利等，通常涉及创造性的作品、技术创新或商业信息等领域。

词组：

  • in terms of - 关于，就……而言。

    原文例句：Alibaba owns the South China Morning Post.

    例句讲解：这个词组通常用来说明或强调某件事的具体情况或方面。

句子：

  • Baidu said on Thursday it would donate its Baidu Institute for Quantum Computing and associated experiment apparatus to BAQIS, a government-backed laboratory. - 百度周四宣布将把百度量子计算研究所和相关的实验仪器捐赠给政府支持的实验室BAQIS。

    句子分析：这是一个复合句，主句是Baidu said it would donate its Baidu Institute for Quantum Computing and associated experiment apparatus to BAQIS，其中主语是Baidu，谓语是said，宾语是it would donate its Baidu Institute for Quantum Computing and associated experiment apparatus to BAQIS。on Thursday是一个时间状语，表示周四。a government-backed laboratory是一个定语从句，修饰BAQIS，表示BAQIS是一个政府支持的实验室。这个句子的意思是说，百度周四宣布将把百度量子计算研究所和相关的实验仪器捐赠给政府支持的实验室BAQIS。

语法：

  • 现在完成时 - 表示从过去某个时间开始一直持续到现在的动作或状态。

    原文例句：Chinese scientists use quantum computing to simulate black hole.

    语法讲解：这是一种时态，结构是：have/has + been + 过去分词。其中have/has要根据主语的人称和数进行变化，been是be的过去分词，过去分词是动词的-ed形式。这种时态表示动作或状态从过去某个时间开始一直持续到现在，强调动作或状态的持续性和未完成性。在这个例句中，它表示中国科学家已经使用了量子计算来模拟黑洞。

  • 被动语态 - 表示动作或状态是由句子主语以外的人或事物引起的或造成的。

    原文例句：New US investment curbs to have limited impact on China’s targeted tech sectors.

    语法讲解：这是一种语态，结构是：be + 过去分词。其中be要根据主语的人称和数进行变化，过去分词是动词的-ed形式。被动语态表示动作或状态是由句子主语以外的人或事物引起的或造成的，强调动作或状态的接受者。在这个例句中，它表示新的美国投资限制对中国的目标科技行业的影响有限。

  • Last March, Baidu and BAQIS jointly launched the country’s first quantum computing intellectual property alliance, with the goal of facilitating easier IP cross-licensing
  • In 2023, Alibaba’s in-house research institution Damo Academy announced it was donating its own quantum lab to Zhejiang University

Chinese search engine giant Baidu is donating its quantum computing research facility to the Beijing Academy of Quantum Information Sciences (BAQIS), in a move similar to one made last year by e-commerce giant Alibaba Group Holding, as both firms lock horns in the country’s artificial intelligence (AI) race.

Baidu said on Thursday it would donate its Baidu Institute for Quantum Computing and associated experiment apparatus to BAQIS, a government-backed laboratory. The two parties are currently discussing details of the donation, according to a company statement.

Beijing-based Baidu, which was an early Chinese investor in AI applications including autonomous driving, established its quantum computing facility in early 2018.

New US investment curbs to have limited impact on China’s targeted tech sectors

It was launched with a mission to “become a top-tier global quantum computing research institution in five years”, with a focus on several areas including quantum AI, quantum algorithms and quantum architecture, according to local media the Paper.

In March last year, Baidu and BAQIS jointly launched the country’s first quantum computing intellectual property (IP) alliance, with the goal of facilitating easier IP cross-licensing and innovation in the industry.

Quantum computing is an emerging field of science that harnesses the principles of fundamental physics to solve problems too complex for traditional computers.

While quantum computers are not designed to replace traditional computers, they are able to solve very complex statistical problems via simultaneous multiple calculations, making them much faster.

Chinese scientists use quantum computing to simulate black hole

China and the US have been competing for supremacy in this field in recent years, although the technology is still in its early stage of development. Beijing did not define the area as a national priority until late 2020.

Last November, Alibaba’s in-house research institution Damo Academy announced it was donating its own quantum lab to Zhejiang University. Alibaba owns the South China Morning Post.

Damo Academy said at the time that it would become more focused on fundamental research in AI and its application in areas such as agriculture and healthcare.

While quantum computing is still a long way from achieving large-scale commercialisation, the new trend of generative AI has been spreading rapidly around the world.

OpenAI, which unleashed a new era of AI with its conversational bot ChatGPT, was reported to be generating annual revenues of US$1.6 billion, according to US digital media outlet The Information. The San-Francisco-based start-up’s rival Anthropic was forecast to rake in over US$850 billion in annualised revenue by the end of 2024.

TikTok Shop, combining online entertainment and impulse buying, intends to capitalize on its social media reach and viral videos to attract buyers. TikTok Shop has been successful in snatching a portion of Chinese consumer spending from Alibaba and JD.com due to its user-friendly interface, free shipping, and subsidies for influencers. TikTok 计划将其美国电子商务业务的规模扩大十倍，达到 175 亿美元，这对亚马逊构成了更大的威胁。TikTok Shop 结合了在线娱乐和冲动购物，旨在利用其社交媒体影响力和病毒式视频来吸引买家。该公司寻求在美国和拉丁美洲扩张销售，计划在未来几个月在这些地区推出电子商务业务，两位知情人士透露。TikTok 在一份声明中表示：“彭博社报道的美国商品销售数字推测不准确。”字节跳动由张一鸣和梁汝波于十多年前创立，由于短视频平台 TikTok 及其中国兄弟应用抖音的病毒式传播，公司发展成为一家估值超过 2000 亿美元的互联网巨头。TikTok Shop 是这家总部位于北京的非上市公司的增长最快的功能之一，它正在寻求社交媒体广告之外的新增长动力。字节跳动 2023 年的收入激增约 30%，超过 1100 亿美元，领先于增长速度远更慢的老牌社交媒体竞争对手 Meta Platforms 和腾讯控股。TikTok Shop 允许用户在滚动浏览其主要社交媒体应用程序内的短视频和直播的永久供稿时购买商品，希望消费者将其用作亚马逊或 Sea 的 Shopee 的替代品。这种形式——努力将亚马逊购物的便利性与 Meta 的 Instagram 等应用程序提供的产品发现相结合——已经帮助抖音从阿里巴巴集团控股和京东手中抢夺了很大一部分中国消费支出，特别是在疫情期间的封锁规定驱使人们在网上花费更多时间之后。阿里巴巴拥有南华早报。TikTok Shop 允许用户在滚动浏览短视频和直播的永久供稿时购买商品。图片来源：Shutterstock Images 字节跳动有意将其电子商务模式出口到全球。在美国，TikTok 为在视频和直播中兜售小工具、服装和化妆品的网红提供免费送货和补贴。该公司表示，在 11 月黑色星期五和网络星期一促销活动的推动下，超过 500 万新美国客户在 TikTok 上购买了商品。该公司在美国拥有约 1.5 亿用户。TikTok 于周三宣布，将从 4 月开始对商家收取每次销售 6% 的费用，并在 7 月开始对大多数产品类别的销售收取 8% 的费用，这标志着用于吸引卖家的促销活动即将结束。这些佣金仍然远低于亚马逊卖家费用，后者的费用通常约为 15%，但这表明 TikTok 正迅速从中获得收入。美国人越来越习惯在中国的电子商务应用程序上购物，其中包括颇受欢迎的时尚网站 Shein 和 PDD Holdings 的 Temu，自 2 月份在超级碗播放广告以来，Temu 的人气激增。尚不清楚 TikTok Shop 为全球或其他市场设定的销售目标。在印度尼西亚，TikTok 已通过一笔 15 亿美元的交易控制了 GoTo 集团的电子商务部门 Tokopedia，这使该公司在经过几个月当地政府的审查后重新启动其在线零售服务。
  • 摘要：TikTok 在美国电子商务市场中的雄心勃勃的目标和战略。

    • TikTok’s ambitious target sets up a clash not just with Amazon, but also fellow Chinese-owned outfits Temu and Shein
    • TikTok was last year on track to amass around US$20 billion in global gross merchandise value, with Southeast Asia contributing the bulk of sales

    TikTok, the global hit short-video platform owned by ByteDance, aims to grow the size of its US e-commerce business tenfold to as much as US$17.5 billion this year, according to people familiar with the matter, posing a bigger threat to Amazon.com.

    The 2024 merchandise volume goal for the US version of TikTok Shop – which melds online entertainment with impulse buying – was discussed in internal meetings in recent weeks and may still change depending on how the business goes, said the people, who asked not to be named discussing private information.

    TikTok’s ambitious target sets up a clash not just with Amazon but also fellow Chinese-owned budget retail outfits Temu and Shein, which have been making big strides among younger American shoppers.

    Unlike its two rival discounters, TikTok is counting on its social media reach and the appeal of viral videos to hook buyers.

    JD.com, Alibaba’s Taobao push ‘refund only’ policy to rival Pinduoduo’s strategy

    TikTok was last year on track to amass around US$20 billion in global gross merchandise value, with Southeast Asia contributing the bulk of sales through its platform, Bloomberg News reported. The company is now seeking to expand sales across the US and Latin America, where it is planning to launch the e-commerce operation in coming months, two people familiar with the matter said.

    “The speculated US merchandise sales figures represented by Bloomberg are inaccurate,” TikTok said in a statement.

    ByteDance, founded more than a decade ago by Zhang Yiming and Liang Rubo, grew into an internet leader worth more than US$200 billion thanks to the virality of short-video platforms TikTok and its Chinese sibling Douyin. TikTok Shop is one of the fastest-growing features for the Beijing-based, closely held company, which is seeking a new growth driver beyond social-media advertising. ByteDance’s revenue surged roughly 30 per cent in 2023 to more than US$110 billion, outpacing the projected growth of far more established social media rivals Meta Platforms and Tencent Holdings.

    TikTok Shop lets users buy items while scrolling through a perpetual feed of short videos and live streams within its main social media app, hoping consumers use it as an alternative to Amazon or Sea’s Shopee. That format – an effort to combine the ease of shopping on Amazon with the product discovery afforded by apps like Meta’s Instagram – has already helped Douyin snatch a significant portion of Chinese consumer spending from Alibaba Group Holding and JD.com, particularly after lockdown rules during the pandemic drove people to spend more time online. Alibaba owns the South China Morning Post.

    ByteDance is intent on exporting its e-commerce model globally. In the US, TikTok is offering free shipping and subsidies to influencers who peddle gadgets, clothes and make-up in videos and live streams. In November, boosted by Black Friday and Cyber Monday deals, more than 5 million new US customers bought something on TikTok, the company said. It has roughly 150 million users in the country.

    TikTok on Wednesday announced it will increase fees imposed on merchants to 6 per cent of each sale beginning in April and to 8 per cent in July in most product categories, marking an end to promotions used to entice sellers. Those commissions are still significantly lower than Amazon seller fees, which are typically about 15 per cent, but the boost signals TikTok is quickly moving to generate revenue from its e-commerce platform.

    Americans are increasingly comfortable shopping on Chinese e-commerce apps, including the popular fashion site Shein and PDD Holdings' Temu, which has exploded in popularity since airing a Super Bowl ad in February.

    It is unclear what sales targets TikTok Shop has set globally or for other markets. In Indonesia, TikTok has taken control of GoTo Group’s e-commerce unit Tokopedia in a US$1.5 billion deal, which allowed the company to restart its online retail service after months of scrutiny by the local government.

item.title: Apple leads US$383 billion tech rout in reversal from group’s 2023 rally
item.description:

  • After a strong performance in 2023, the so-called "Magnificent Seven" tech stocks (Apple, Amazon, Alphabet, Microsoft, Meta Platforms, Tesla, and Nvidia) have faced a downturn in the last four trading days, leading to a decline in the Bloomberg Magnificent 7 Price Return Index.
  • Investors' concerns over the sustainability of the 2023 rally and the Federal Reserve's ability to achieve a soft landing for the economy have contributed to the decline.
  • Specific stock pressure has been observed, with Apple facing downgrades due to concerns about iPhone demand and Tesla losing its top position in electric vehicle sales to BYD.
  • Despite the downturn, some tech stocks still have room to grow, as they remain below their all-time highs.
  • However, continued delivery of solid and profitable technology is crucial for these companies to maintain investor confidence.

  • 投资者对2023年反弹的可持续性以及美联储实现经济软着陆能力的担忧导致下滑。

语法：

  • 动词不定式 - 表示动作或状态。

    原文例句：Tesla has shed 8.8 per cent in the last four days, its longest streak of losses in more than four weeks.

  • 比较级 - 表示两个事物或情况之间的比较。

    原文例句：Apple leads premium smartphone market in 2023, but Huawei gains ground with new 5G handsets.

    语法讲解：比较级是由形容词或副词的原级加上“er”或“more”构成的，表示两个事物或情况之间的比较。在这个例句中，“more”表示“更多”，是比较级。

  • The Magnificent Seven surged more than 100 per cent last year, driven by a frenzy in artificial intelligence, gains cooled in the second half of 2023
  • Though Tesla said it delivered more electric vehicles in the fourth quarter than analysts expected, the company lost its place as top seller of EVs to China’s BYD

The largest technology stocks that lifted the broader market last year are having a less-rosy start to 2024.

The so-called Magnificent Seven, which includes Apple, Amazon.com, Alphabet, Microsoft, Meta Platforms, Tesla and Nvidia, slipped for the last four trading days, the longest losing streak in a month, according to the Bloomberg Magnificent 7 Price Return Index.

Shares of Apple, down 4.6 per cent in the time period, lead the slump that has erased US$383 billion in market value. The Nasdaq 100 Index has also fallen in the last four trading days.

“We don’t know if last year’s rally has fully ended, but it is completely normal to expect markets will pull back after a rally like we saw,” said Steve Sosnick, chief strategist at Interactive Brokers Group. “Without the year-end factors that turbocharged the rally, I think we’re seeing the party winding down.”

Apple leads premium smartphone market in 2023, but Huawei gains ground with new 5G handsets

It is a signal that investor doubts over the sticking power of the 2023 rally were well-placed.

Though the Magnificent Seven surged more than 100 per cent last year, driven by a frenzy in artificial intelligence, gains cooled in the second half of 2023 as investors mulled the Federal Reserve’s ability to execute a soft landing for the US economy, which would likely mean fewer interest rate cuts than expected.

“You’re not going to get high-single-digit or double-digit earnings growth if we get something worse than a soft landing,” Sosnick said. “But we’re not going to get six cuts with a soft landing.”

A few members of the group have also seen specific stock pressure early this year. Apple shares have been weighed down after gaining a new bear; Barclays analysts early this week downgraded shares of the tech giant to underweight, saying they expect soft demand for iPhones going forward.

Apple hits 7-week low after Barclays downgrade on demand concerns

Tesla has shed 8.8 per cent in the last four days, its longest streak of losses in more than four weeks. Though Tesla reported on Tuesday that it delivered more electric vehicles in the fourth quarter than analysts expected, the company lost its place as the top seller of electric cars to China’s BYD.

To be sure, it is likely too early to say the tech-focused rally is over. Most of 2023’s gains recouped losses from a year earlier, and some of the group – Amazon, Alphabet, Meta and Tesla – are still below their all-time highs, signalling they could have room to run.

But, the largest tech names also have their work cut out for them in 2024. The companies need to continue to deliver not only solid technology, but profitable technology going forward, according to Sosnick.

“In December everyone bought the sizzle,” he said. “Now we have to see if the steak is any good.”

  • Taobao and JD.com have introduced policies that allow shoppers to receive a refund for a product they are unhappy with even though they keep it
  • Some merchants have raised concerns that consumers may look to exploit the terms of these ‘refund only’ policies, hitting their operations

New “refund only” policies introduced by Chinese e-commerce players including Alibaba Group Holding’s Taobao and JD.com have sparked concern among some sellers about potential abuse of the terms, according to merchants and analysts.

Taobao and JD.com in late December introduced new policies that – in certain circumstances – allow shoppers to receive a refund for a product they are unhappy with even though they keep it. This may occur when a consumer complains about the poor quality of a product, or about an inaccurate and misleading description on the platform. Alibaba owns the South China Morning Post.

Alibaba, whose company mission is “to make it easy to do business anywhere”, had a long internal debate over whether to follow rival Pinduoduo, which was the first to offer a policy whereby a shopper can receive a refund for a product they are unhappy with even though they do not return it.

Even though some merchants have raised concerns about potential abuse, Alibaba came down on the side of consumer rights in such a situation as merchants are ultimately dependent on buyer confidence, according to a person briefed on the discussions who asked not to be identified.

JD.com, Alibaba’s Taobao push ‘refund only’ policy to rival Pinduoduo’s strategy

However, since the policy went into effect last week there has been an increased number of claims under the “refund but keep the purchase” policy, according to one merchant who runs apparel shops on both Taobao and JD.com, adding that some consumers were looking to exploit the situation.

The 33-year-old online shop owner, who spoke on condition of anonymity for fear of retribution from the platforms, said that the new refund policy could backfire and hit sellers who invest in high-quality products, because they will bear higher costs in the event of more claims.

“This refund terms only works for merchants who sell dirt-cheap goods,” she said, adding that the policy clearly favoured consumers.

Meanwhile, some merchants took to social media platforms such as Douyin and Weibo to express anger at the potential for policy abuse.

One user with the handle “PengqiangweiVerna” posted on Weibo that the practice will “foster a group of online freeloaders”. Another Douyin user called “Xinzhouxiaohuolang” posted a dozen videos denouncing such refund requests.

Both Taobao and JD.com have said that any decisions on refund requests on their platforms will be based on multiple indicators, including the track records of both merchants and buyers, along with big data analysis to support their judgments.

A person familiar with the situation at Taobao, who asked not to be identified as they are not authorised to talk to the media, said that the platform has offered merchants an appeal option if they think they have been wronged.

Taobao and JD.com did not immediately respond to requests for comment on Wednesday.

Pinduoduo’s original “refund but keep the product” practice was initially launched in 2021 and is seen as a key factor behind the Shanghai-based budget-shopping platform’s rise to prominence.

Tang Guangyao, a 38-year-old Beijing software developer, said he has shifted from other e-commerce platforms to Pinduoduo as a primary shopping channel owing to its robust consumer protection, even though it focuses on budget prices.

But some analysts say simply following Pinduoduo’s lead may not work for rival platforms.

“This [new refund policy] isn’t very practical for platforms such as Taobao, Tmall and JD.com,” said Zhang Yi, founder and chief analyst at Guangzhou-based iiMedia, pointing out that Pinduoduo’s focus on rock-bottom prices means that the costs of the scheme are more bearable than for merchants on rival sites.

“By following this [Pinduoduo] refund policy … [rival platforms] will give their merchants a dilemma,” he added.
